description:
Enjoyed the Choco-Vanilla Bean 
Swirl
Ice cream with/
Waffle cone 
&
It was a delicious treat after
A walk in nearby 
San Francisco botanical gardens
author: Jaxk E.

description:
Best soft serve hands down. Personally, I go for a waffle cone with vanilla and olive oil with sea salt but the chocolate dipped is great as well. 

Thank the lord for places doing gods work like these guys.
author: Henry A.

description:
I love this place!!!!!!! The vanilla bean ice cream is amazing especially if you get it dipped with the sea salt. It's in my top 5 ice creams in SF, but the biggest downside is the price. The price for the ice cream without the extras is $5 and with the extras is $7 which is a LOT of money for ice cream. Still worth it... but I think I would get it a lot more if with the extras it was $5. It is also quite far from other things unless you're in the park and going to the museums in the area, so I wish I could come here more often than I do. If you're in the area and have $7 in CASH ONLY to spare, you need to go! 

One thing I will mention - their truck is frequently closed or they close early, etc. so check their twitter before you head there to prevent you from being disappointed - literally has happened to me so many times, it's upsetting!
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
Stopped by here on a whim after a quite filling lunch and several drinks. Tipsy me enjoys random ice cream adventures. Hell, sober me enjoys random ice cream adventures. 

This truck is quite easy to find and parking wasn't an issue. However, they are cash only so be prepared. 

My boyfriend and I shared a chocolate and vanilla swirl soft serve on a cone with honeycomb candy. Yum! I really enjoyed all the flavors, however next time I would try the chocolate dip. The honeycomb candy was scrumptious but a little crunchy with the soft serve. 

Prices a bit steep, but that's for everywhere in the city. Grab a cone and enjoy the beauty golden gate park has to offer.
author: Issy D.

description:
CASH ONLYYYYYY. Hopefully this post will have helped some yelpers go to the atm before heading here :) FYI that there IS a janky atm right on Lincoln and 9th so if you don't have money, that's the closest place to get that doughhh.

I got the vanilla and chocolate twirl with the chocolate dip. The dip isn't completely hardened so biting into it, it was a bit soft. Not that big of a complaint, I just wish that it was an actual *shell* instead. Still good flavor though. 

I love that they're located inside Golden Gate Park - this truck is a perfect pit stop for dates or a family outing!

Be sure to grab a couple of extra napkins because the ice cream has no regards for your hands!
author: Cathy C.

description:
It was a normal freezing day in golden gate park. What a perfect way to enjoy a nice cup of delicious ice cream! 

I had their sundae special, lol and we were there on a Sunday waiting in line for the cal academy of science free day.

The ice cream was delicious! It was a hard hit with $9 but there was plenty of toppings.  A little too much toppings.....but it was great! There was only one worker there and even through there were people waiting, he made it in a good amount of time and it looked beautiful! I would try their dipped cones next time!
author: Lynn C.

description: Yo Tai.... please don't close up shop just yet! This ice cream was amazing!!!!!!!! Thank you so much! Best dipped cone I've ever had in my whole life. I had the vanilla bean ice cream in a cone, dipped! Twirl and dip ... that's the only way to do it here folks! My wife and sister were with me and I had to let them try some of mine. We all agreed.... best ever! How in the world do you get that much chocolate to stick to the ice cream.... I'm boggled! The taste of the sweet vanilla bean ice cream in the center brings the perfect balance to the table. Tai... you've got to find a way man... keep this place open.... people don't know what they'll be missing out on if you do. For those reading I met the owner (Tai) and he said he's closing down after 9 years of business. I wish I had the funny to fund you man! Loved it ! Definitely a 5 star IMO. Great treat!
author: David N.

description: It's been over a year since I went to Twirl and Dip and I was craving soft served icecream, so I stopped by. I got the vanilla soft served dipped in chocolate. It was not as good as I remembered it. I thought that the chocolate was too soft and the soft serve inside was a bit watery. Taking into account that it was also pricey, I don't think I'll be coming back for a long while.
author: Kristine P.

description: It was a hot day in the park and chanced about this great ice cream truck. All natural,organic chocolate ice cream in a cone dipped in chocolate was great.
author: Sunil R.

description:
This is the best chocolate dipped soft serve ice cream cone I've ever had!! I asked the worker if I could split one serving into half so my little kids could have the right portion and he was more than happy to that. We got the chocolate vanilla swirl. As he handed me the two cones he apologized that they were leaking (I understand that it would leak since the ice cream to hot chocolate ratio was off) . I saw white liquid with black specks( yep, real vanilla bean) trickle down and I knew just then that I was in for a treat. The chocolate was sooooo delicious, thick and just the right consistency and the cone... Oh the cone. It was the best cone ever!! The ice cream was rich and flavorful and I loved the two flavors together. 

They're located on a main road in Golden gate park, right next to bike rentals, the Japanese tea garden, de young museum and the academy of sciences. 

The prices are a bit higher than average but that's because it's high quality ice cream in a great location. I'd buy this ice cream again in a heartbeat. 

Great ice cream and great service in a beautiful park with perfect weather!
author: Katherine F.

description:
OK, this was a GREAT stop on a warm, sunny day in SF.

We were at the SF Zoo, waiting in line to get soft serve before leaving. The line was stopped. Not moving. For a very long time. Bored, I queried Yelp! for nearby soft serve. Twirl and Dip came up, the truck was in Golden Gate Park, so we decided to check it out. What a treat! 

There was a VERY long line for the truck, which had me worried at first. Fortunately, the line inched along consistently so it didn't take long for us to reach the front. The menu of soft serve is incredible, with many different flavors, toppings and suggestions for elevating the experience of soft serve enjoyment.

Do note that the truck accepts CASH ONLY. Not a big deal if you're buying for 2 or 3 people. But, if you're a family of four and you bring a couple of the kids' friends along, you'll need to prepare ahead of time for the bill as this premium desert comes with the price tag to match. It would be great if they accepted payment via square or paypal or apple pay or android pay or SOMETHING other than cash. That's my only suggestion.

Great food, great service, we'll definitely be back. Cheers!
author: Ryan O.

description:
That's such a shame their location on Potrero closed down. I guess the downside was that they were pretty expensive. I remember paying around $7 or more once when getting a honeycomb topping. I vowed not to do that again, but now I can't at all. The price is about $4 for the soft serve, but be weary that the price for toppings can add up. Twirl and dip has such wonderful soft serve and toppings. My favorite is their great chocolate dip that holds together well. 

Twirl and dip has been at Golden Gate Park for a long time. Soft serve is a perfect addition to a stroll around the park.
author: Jaime F.

description: We stopped here once on our way to the Botanical Garden and once on the way back from it. I love that they have vegan options. I would highly recommend their chocolate dipped ice cream cone, it really is delicious. I also got the black cherry Popsicle which was also pretty good. Friendly customer service, only thing I would recommend is not to be cash only. I not it's probably convenient but luckily one of my friends had cash or we wouldn't of been able to try the ice cream truck out!
author: Mayci R.

description:
Aw man! I constantly crave this ice cream, and quite honestly I'm not even a huge fan of ice cream. 

Not your typical soft serve. Rich and creamy, their ice cream is on point. They take it to the next level with TCHO chocolate dip, and then, they take it out of this world with toppings. 

MUST:
- Get your ice cream in a cone, and dipped
- Get the maldon sea salt 
- Get a topping

Yeah, it's pricey. You could easily pay double digits for an ice cream with toppings. But honestly, even a price stickler like me is wiling to wait in line and pay top dollar for Twirl & Dip whenever I'm in the area. I'm obsessed!!!
author: Vivian N.

description:
TWIRL the ice cream and DIP it in chocolate! 

I was addicted after I tried my first Twirl and Dip dipped cone. This is different from any other ordinary dipped ice cream cone. I think of it is a hybrid between frozen yogurt and ice cream. It's not quite frozen yogurt, but ice cream in the form of frozen yogurt. The rich ice cream is creamed with organic milk, making it the perfect consistency. The hints of vanilla bean blends well and brings out the sweetness. It's dipped in very good quality TCHO chocolate. Of course, no ice cream cone is complete without the chocolate shell.

Service: The guy at the window is patient and helpful. However, I saw that he doesn't wear gloves and uses his bare hands, after he touched money, to sprinkle the salt onto the cones, which has not very sanitary. 

 Even though it's a bit pricey for an ice cream cone, it's worth every penny.
author: Michelle F.

description: I liked the ice cream, but found it too overpriced. A 5oz scoop plus chocolate dip was $7 total. We are talking about a food truck here, it's not that they have to keep up an entire store with seating etc. The flavors were somewhat limited, so I went with plain vanilla. Fine, but nothing to write home about. Without the topping, I would have been disappointed. I'm glad I went for the chocolate dip, it comes with a little bit of sea salt, which gives it a nice touch. They charge you $2 extra for this - more reasonable than the initial $5 just for the ice cream. Still, overpriced.
author: Katja S.

description:
I finally got to try Twirl and Dip after a spending some time hanging out at the SF Botanical Garden.  They were conveniently located right across the street from the Botanical Garden entrance near the corner of Martin Luther King, Jr Drive and Hagiwara Tea Garden Drive which is actually a smart location for them because they also get a lot of foot traffic from the Japanese Tea Garden, California Academy of Sciences, and the De Young Museum.

Their menu is pretty intimidating when you first see it because they have so many different items and options to choose from (http://bit.ly/29Z8oeK).  I just decided to go with that they're known for and order have their Vanilla Bean Chocolate Twirl Soft Serve dipped in TCHO Dark Chocolate in a sugar cup and then sprinkled with sea salt (http://bit.ly/29DYg91).  Oh man!  The swirl ice cream was really good, but what really made it shine was the TCHO chocolate dip.   So good!!  They didn't put too much sea salt on mine compared to other pics I've seen, but that was fine. The sea salt was subtle and the sweet with salty combo was great.  Unfortunately they were out of sugar cones that day, but the sugar cup worked just as fine which I actually prefer because cones usually tend to leak at the bottom.  I would totally order this again!

Overall, I know I just had one thing from their menu, but that was enough for me to say that Twirl and Dip is awesome!  I don't usually head out to Golden Gate Park that often, but at least I know now that if I'm hanging out there and need to satisfy a sweet tooth, I can depend on Twirl and Dip to fill that craving.
author: Rodney H.

description: Sadly, the chocolate "dip" shell is not crunchy. It was thick and soft. The chocolate soft serve is good. Not worth $7. But they have a great location inside Golden Gate Park on the south side - just south of the California Academy of Sciences.
author: Thien H.

description:
Tried the vanilla cone with the dipped chocolate. The cone tasted normal but the chocolate on it was the thickest and chocolaty thing ever! So uh, come by for that!

Go for: the best chocolate dipped cone

Don't go for: a budget dessert
author: John V.

description: Cash only!! I've been here before and it was a delight. But I stopped by today and forgot it was cash only. Didn't have any on me. Cry cry cry. The super friendly guy in the truck pointed us to an ATM (I didn't need it that badly), but also gave us samples for the road. Delightful.
author: Laura S.

description: After all of my Cal Academy trips, we finally caved and got a vanilla bean/chocolate swirl sugar cone. I've never had vanilla bean soft serve before - it was incredible!
author: Jarrad W.

description:
I love Mitchell's ice cream as much as the next person - especially the grasshopper pie - but unless you're not from the area there is no reason you should be paying $3.50 for a scoop of Mitchell's. In fact, you should never be ordering a scoop of Mitchell's ever anyway - you need to drive to Mitchell's and buy your ice cream by the bulk. That would be doing Mitchell's right. 

To do Twirl and Dip right, you need to get the organic soft serve, upgrade to the sugar cone (extra $1.50), choose a topping or two (ranges from an extra $0.50-$1.50, depending), and pay with cash. My husband and I are especially partial to vanilla bean + toffee pieces but when it's a celebration, we'll pay the extra $1.50 to dip in TCHO chocolate and get some of that sea salt goodness. It's crazy to have ice cream from a truck that costs almost $10 but we all need to treat ourselves and loved ones now and then, right? I've never regretted an indulgence here and I promise neither will you!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Recommend their soft serve dipped in dark chocolate! Treat yourself to something nice after you've worked so hard strolling in the GG park. :P 

CASH ONLY. Also double check STORE HOURS before you come by.

I ordered a soft serve of vanilla bean/chocolate dipped in dark chocolate, sprinkled w/ sea salt. It a little pricey for ice cream ($5.5) but I had no regret. The dark chocolate coating was thick but melted in my mouth. The chocolate coating also held the ice cream inside, or else I would have dripped all over my top. The ice cream itself tasted great and velvety. Bring back memories of childhood when we would get soft serve at Chinese buffet. 

The staff was very friendly. He saw us contemplating about the menu and offered to help. The ice cream was ready within 1 min! 

I would definitely bring my friends here and to enjoy some sweets and catch up on life!
author: Wendy F.

description: Omg! I always have to get a swirl chocolate dipped cone w sea salt and be extra af! Seeing this in the park makes my trip more memorable every time and my heart happy
author: Diana L.

description:
Remember those dip cones from your childhood summers?

THIS IS WAAAAAAY BETTER. Even when you account for the inimitable flavor of memory.

The ice cream is creamier--no cheap fillers--and the chocolate is Tcho--'nuf said.

The only problem is that the calories are much more magnetic than those in the soft-serve ice cream of my youth, even though the bike ride to it is longer?!
author: jazz v.

description: These guys are awesome!!! Friendliest food truck experience ever!! Biked around the park for my birthday and saw the truck from a distance. Long line but by the time we got up to the truck the line was clearly moving through quickly. Yummy popsicles and ice cream (organic) and AWESOME vegan options.
author: David M.

description:
This was a nice treat and would recommend, as long as you have cash on hand! It is a little pricey but I feel like you expect that from an organic SF ice cream truck. We spent the afternoon at the Academy of Science and then a short walk away we found Twirl and Dip. We got the soft serve vanilla bean and chocolate swirl-It is a pretty generous portion so it is easy to share between the two of us.
I wish they would take credit cards (even if we had to pay a small fee to use the card.)
author: Jen L.

description: This is a must to visit!! I always get a chocolate dipped cone with sea salt!
author: Meg F.

description:
I think I enjoyed my ice cream more from Twirl and Dip because of the wonderful service with a smile the hubby and I received. The young gentleman who was by himself and had a line of people waiting to be served was nothing but friendly. San Francisco can be a very unfriendly city (comparatively speaking), and it's so refreshing when people are nice to you! 

We had the ice cream, not the soft serve. They had three flavors of Mitchell's Ice Cream the day we went (strawberry, pistachio and grasshopper pie), and since I'm an ice cream fanatic, we got a sundae to share. Two scoops of pistachio ice cream, Toasted Coconut, Butterscotch, Whipped Cream and a Luxardo Cherry on top! Delicious! Not too sweet and we just loved the toasted coconut and butterscotch combination. 

Next time, I'd like to try their Soft Serve which is from Straus Creamery. You can get it dipped and covered in dark chocolate and garnished with sea salt if you'd like. You can also order soft serve in their handmade cones and topped with handmade toppings like toffee, sauces and syrups. They also have these beautiful and colorful ice lollies. Yum! 

So, if you're in Golden Gate Park by the California Academy of Science or the de Young Museum, stop by this truck. Its location is the same everyday on Martin Luther King Dr. We passed by the truck on our way to our car from the de Young, and though the truck was closed already, the young man was still in there cleaning up. He saw us, waved to us and gave us another smile. Wouldn't that make you want to come back?!
author: Hazel C.

description:
Vanilla ice cream dipped in Tcho chocolate, and a fresh made waffle cone -- what else can you ask for? Sometimes I just randomly think about Twirl and Dip ice cream, it's that good! 

So why only 4 stars? Because the lines are long, it's cash only, and it takes a while to deliver the darn cone. Yes, it's in a truck, I get it ... just not worth the wait unless I'm in the park already.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
A hip ice cream truck in Golden Gate Park?! Where there is nearly no other food besides the overpriced cafeteria at the Academy of Sciences?! And where you are likely to get hungry walking around the massive park?!!? Serving photogenic ice cream with a unique concept?!!! SUGAR, YES PLEASSEEEE!!

Okay that was a bit of a melodramatic start, but exorbitantly pricey though Twirl and Dip is, I must admit their creations are original and tasty, and their location just makes it ever more tempting. 

Their most basic soft serve is $4, but it quickly adds up if you get their specialty dark chocolate dip for an additional $1.50 and their handmade sugar cone for another $1.50. Although $7 could have bought me an entire meal, Twirl and Dip (with the extravagant extras) is worth trying. The quick-dry chocolate sauce coating essentially makes a fresh ice cream bar, and the handmade sugar cone reminds me of Ici's magical cones in Berkeley. Overall,  I would have liked it to be less sweet, but it's nonetheless an indulgent treat and filling (we shared and I was still quite full by dinnertime).

Twirl and Dip... the ice cream truck for adults (who are well-off enough to be able to spend $7 for an afternoon snack, and who are hip enough to want to do so).
author: Edna C.

description:
My 2 yo and I went to GGP to the Academy of Sciences on a weekend and around the corner was the ever popular Twirl and Dip. Well, it was hot out and she wanted ice cream. How could I say No? So, we saw the long line, the good reviews and had to do it.

     We ordered the original soft serve vanilla in one of their cones dipped in chocolate and sea salt. I must say it was indeed delicious and we were glad we got one. BUT it was $7 dollars for a regular size ice cream cone. A little on the pricey side. I would have been mad if we didn't like it so much. Given the quality of the ice cream we let this pricey cone pass.

     Would I do it again? Maybe, if I really wanted ice cream and there was no other options around. Would I go out of my way to find Twirl and Dip? Probably not. Right place, Right time.
author: Ro M.

description:
I came across Twirl and Dip a while back and it's been on my list to try ever since. We were in the general area but went out of our way on a nice Sunday walk through Golden Gate Park for a sweet pit stop.

Really enjoyed our vanilla/chocolate twirl soft serve, dipped in TCHO chocolate with a sprinkle of Maldon sea salt, on a plain cone. It didn't take much, but the sea salt brought it home for me and elevated the flavor. Price breakdown was $4 for the soft serve on the plain cone (homemade sugar cone is more) and chocolate dip was an additional $1.50. Luckily we had cash on us (no cards accepted).

Like any ice cream on a cone it can get messy, even on a cold day in SF. Ask for more napkins!
author: Lindsey C.

description:
Twirl and Dip came to my work place for a corporate event, so I can't comment much on the pricing or wait, but I can talk about the food.  Here's what I tried:

-Watermelon and white pepper
WOW! This tasted EXACTLY like a watermelon on a stick--so much that I really did say "wow" out loud when I first tried it.  I didn't taste much of the "white pepper" part of the lolly, however.  The lolly also tasted like it had been sweeted, which it didn't need.  The natural sweetness of the watermelon would have been enough.  I think it would have been interesting to see a watermelon and lime juice combinator.  I wasn't a huge fan of the circular shape: While it did make the lolly stand out from usual ice pops, I think the circular shape made it more conducive to melting or dripping with the increased surface area.

-Chocolate/Vanilla soft serve swirl
The swirl was probably a poor decision on my part because I couldn't really sample or appreciate the two flavors on their own-- the chocolate just overpowered the vanilla.  The soft serve ice cream in my work cafe is the straus organic vanilla and chocolate, and that is what I've been having a lot of this summer.  The soft serve from Twirl and Dip didn't seem to be that much different from the ones we have in our cafes.  The vanilla soft serve had little black specs of vanilla beans in it, and although I appreciated that attention to quality, I couldn't taste a huge difference.  The chocolate was fine, but more of a milk chocolate than a deep, dark chocolate.  Both flavors were very rich and creamy, but not super memorable or impressive.

The men serving the ice cream in the truck were super friendly as well!
author: Michelle W.

description:
Vanilla bean chocolate twirl ($4) - it's a vanilla and chocolate mixed soft serve, but the vanilla is fancier than normal. Vanilla bean!!! It's pretty yummy

Grasshopper Pie ($4) - basically mint chocolate chip ice cream. But, the chocolate chunks were too big and there's also fudge in it, which I didn't like. It was still good though!
author: Esther Y.

description: The best cone I've ever had in my life. The vanilla bean was phenomenal. Definitely worth $5!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
Have to review again based on the recent trip! Chocolate dipped still the best and super thick covered w almonds! I didn't know they only did chocolate dipped with the soft serve only. I went ahead and ordered Mitchell's coconut ice cream and asked for it dipped...he returned with my dipped cone and said they don't usually dip the ice creams! Awesome! Thanks for still serving it and keeping your customer happy!!!


Best chocolate dip I've had compared to Mitchell's, dq, etc. Just ran into this truck by accident after walking around the conservatory of flowers. It's quit convenient as its right around the corner where you walk into the academy of science area.

Got a vanilla chocolate swirl cone chocolate dipped. Total of $5.50. Would definitely return despite it being a little over priced. Chocolate dipped itself cost $1.50
author: Carmen L.

description: Expensive ice cream, but looked so good that you just have to have one.  And everyone was in line to get a dipped cone.  You could get a pint of ice cream for the cost of a single dipped cone. Cest la vie.
author: Nyla K.

description: Chocolate dipped vanilla ice cream on a cone brought me right back to childhood today. The chocolate sauce tasted like *real* chocolate and the vanilla ice cream tasted like real vanilla, it was scrumptuous.
author: Joel D.

description:
Toffee Crunch Sundae, $8.00: twirl soft serve, chocolate sauce, butterscotch sauce, toffee pieces, toasted almonds, whipped cream with a cherry on top.

I ordered the Toffee Crunch sundae, which was quite an indulgent treat (and I loved every minute of it!). The toffee bits and butterscotch sauce (and everything else, really) melded together perfectly. A little pricey but worth it if splurging :) 

CASH only
Stay on left side of rope line/retractable divider (so customers are not in way of pedestrians walking on sidewalk)
author: Denise M.

description: This truck is amazing! Stopped by with the family, I forget the name of what I ordered but it was the one with homemade toffee. For a split second after ordering I thought to myself, "this guy is taking forever." Then, he turned around and presented me with the most awe inspiring bowl of soft serve I had ever been a witness to. If I had a time machine, I wouldn't save the world, I would go back to that instant that I thought what I thought and slapped me naked and hid my clothes because in that moment...I was witnessing greatness. A mountain of whipped cream adorned with drizzle, chunks of homemade toffee cascading off its peak lay like rocks in the valley of the ice creams melted goodness. Cherries, almonds, come for the soft serve, stay for the toffee draped in ice cream soup, it's delectable! Damn you, for being so far from Texas!  I miss you.
author: Brock M.

description:
When I saw Twirl and Dip at Golden Gate Park... I  just had to have it!  I just love ice cream (and soft serve is pretty up there too)  The chilly weather was not going to deter me from getting some frozen sweets either. 

This ice cream truck serves soft serve (what they're known for) and Mitchell's ice cream.  I opted for their most popular seller, the soft serve swirl dipped in dark chocolate sprinkled with sea salt.  The dark chocolate and salt had a nice flavor.  The dark chocolate complemented the vanilla soft serve nicely too.  But overall, I was not impressed by this soft serve as a whole.  I wouldn't crave it and wouldn't pay $5.50 again because I found it quite average.  I wanted to love it, maybe i should have stuck to ice cream... either way, I'm glad i gave it a try.  It was nice being able to get ice cream at the park and you should give it a try if you like soft serve and dark chocolate.
author: Betty H.

description: Absolutely divine. This is the best soft serve I have EVER eaten. After saying that, it's even more heavenly when they dip it in the tcho chocolate and top it with a sprinkle of maldon salt. Seriously I'm actively salivating.
author: Heather S.

description: Just overpriced soft serve.  The toppings aren't even that good just sauces and regular toppings.  The only thing I haven't seen is the honeycomb candy which isn't that special.
author: Mark N.

description:
Brilliant idea having an icecream truck in the park. On a warm and sunny Sunday afternoon, strolling in the park, here was this truck with a line and people walking around with a cone or cup in their hand.

A bit pricey for a soft serve, but not bad compared to other places in the city. Depending on the mood, I'd add the dark chocolate dip with salt on my soft serve. Might get a little messy with the dip, but it was a great mix (usually got vanilla soft serve if going for chocolate dip)!
author: Jaclyn C.

description: Absolutely loved this place. Awesome customer service and the softest ice cream ever!! Will definitely come here again!
author: Lizette B.

description: There was a long line in Golden Gate Park but it is well worth it! I wanted one of the lollies but they ran out so I got the grasshopper in the house cone. That cone tastes exactly like a fortune cookie and it was the perfect crisp for the minty ice cream. I should have gotten the vanilla bean and some toppings but didnt. There werent that many ice cream carts around the park so Im glad I got to this one.
author: Amy H.

description: Cash only! This place is always the highlight of my lunchtime walk to the park. The guy that runs the truck is super friendly and the ice cream/Popsicles never fail to satisfy me! I recommend getting the chocolate dipped scoop on a cone with sea salt and peanuts if it's your first time. It is a little pricey, but sooo worth it!
author: Christine G.

description: THE BEST ICECREAM IN THE WHOLE WORLD !!!! If you are in the Bay Area definitely go with twirl and dip , the ice cream is so creamy and if you like dark chocolate you would like the dipped part . I got my ICECREAM fairly quickly and it looked perfect when I first got it ...., then I demolished it in a blast . I wish I could eat it every day . I would recommend this to a friend or a family ! You need to try this place
author: Lucy C.

description:
Unlike ice cream trucks of yore, Twirl & Dip is pretty stationary in a spot to the right of Cal Academy. When you're facing the museum, swing to the right and follow it to the main road and you'll see the truck on your left. Unless Karl the Fog is completely blanketing the park, there's guaranteed to be a bit of a wait. After long walks through the park or multi-mile bike rides, this is how I reward myself. Oh hell, let's be real, I reward myself when I haven't moved all day. I digress. 

What should you get? Don't argue with me. It's organic vanilla bean soft serve (none of this "1/2 1/2 swirl" business), dipped in silky Tcho chocolate topped with barely there granules of Maldon sea salt. If you're looking for an Insta-worthy photo op and I know you are, try rainbow sprinkles, honeycomb candy, toffee pieces, etc for some texture and color. If you're erring on the side of caution and responsibly opting for a cup, there's also a slew of other toppings to choose from including seasonal fruit sauces. 

It only falls one star for how pricey a single cone gets with just one or two add-ons. Unless you're just going for a simple scoop of Mitchell's, a soft-serve cone runs $5-7 easy. But hey, it's organic, fair trade and uses local as much as possible so feel good about your ice-cream indulging self.
author: Faith Y.

description: Best soft serve I've ever had, and I think many will agree. The menu is pretty simple, with vanilla and chocolate soft serve, which you can get dipped in chocolate, a selection of seasonal fruit pops, sundaes, floats, and also scooped ice cream. The vanilla soft serve is HEAVEN in a sugar cone, especially with one of their homemade syrups and honeycomb candy. The floats are also really good, they have a unique soda collection to make them with. The truck is also in a great location, in the center of the park, right outside the De Young Museum. A must have in SF
author: Onik R.

description:
After wandering through SF for a solid four hours, we were tired, grumpy, and on the lookout for ice cream. Zach noticed a truck half a mile away and like a desert oasis we stumbled toward it praying....and yes! It was ice cream!

And some seriously good ice cream at that. He tried a cup of the Oreo with toffee topping. I got the last lucky scoop of brown sugar banana and topped it with candied ginger and butterscotch. "It was the greatest ice cream experience of my life," said Zach, as we sat silently in ice cream nirvana nearby in the Shakespeare Garden.
author: Sol C.

description:
I was a little bit skeptical that I would enjoy soft serve icecream since usually it's just meh. But I was out in Golden Gate park for a picnic and had just broken a sweat from longboarding around the museums, and icecream seemed like an awesome idea at that moment when I saw the Twirl and Dip truck. And it was.

The menu has soft serve on a cone or bowl, sundaes, floats, and a myriad of toppings. I decided to try their regular staple item - soft serve on a cone.

I was going to say, "I'd like a chocolate and vanilla twirl on a plain cone, dipped in dark chocolate with moldan sea salt," which is basically the complete description from the menu. But then I heard the person in front of me order like a pro so I decided to copy him.

"I'd like a twirl dipped in chocolate with sea salt. Plain cone" Yay for being concise and sounding like a regular.

Anyways, the chocolate-dipped twirl really hit the spot. The outer layer of chocolate had hardened from the cold of the icecream, and the inside was delicious and creamy. 

At $5.50 ($4 base price, + $1.50 for chocolate dip), it's a bit pricey. But this is San Francisco so...

Also worth noting is the two guys in the truck were cheerful and friendly, despite there being a long line. It's always nice to have service with a smile.
author: Hain-Lee H.

description:
There's always a line for Twirl and Dip whenever I come through Golden Gate Park so today I finally decided to try it out! I got the vanilla soft serve dipped in chocolate with sea salt in the organic sugar cone and bf got a frozen banana dipped in chocolate with sea salt.

Both things were good but neither of us thought it was anything particularly special or amazing. The chocolate was good and I liked the sugar cone but I was hoping for a stronger vanilla taste in the soft serve itself- it was a little flavorless. I honestly think it's overpriced for what it is. The banana was $3.50 and my soft serve ended up being $7 because of the added chocolate dip and sugar cone. Yikes. For that price I really expected to be wowed but I wasn't. ): I'll still come back to try the ice lollies though and see how those are but yeah. Pretty overpriced for what it is. :/
author: Stephany L.

description:
Not bad. 3.5?
The organic sugar cone was too crumbly for my taste.
The half vanilla, half chocolate twirl was good with the olive oil and sea salt. I thought they could have went a little easy with the olive oil inside the cone because maybe that's why my cone was so crumbly.

Also, my cone wasn't filled to the bottom, when I got close to the bottom third or so, it was empty inside.
It was $13 for this cone and a sugar cone with chocolate dip.
author: Heejin L.

description: I normally don't eat ice cream but I heard great things about this place. I got the vanilla bean with chocolate twirl. It was really tasty and was only 4$. The vanilla bean was my favorite.
author: Seleen T.

description:
1. Find this truck parked in Golden Gate Park.
2. Browse the menu.
3. Order the vanilla bean soft serve dipped in Tcho dark chocolate with sprinkles of Maldon sea salt.
4. Thank the gentleman for the glory you are about to eat.
5. Happily indulge in this sweet goodness as your roam through the park.
author: Jenny C.

description:
It just so happens.....my dog Walks me by Twirl and Dip's truck many times a week. That Dam canine is up to something...he has a plan: Perhaps he has his own yelp account.

Twirl and Dip serves great dipped frozen bananas.... ripe very sweet bananas dipped in  a rich thick chocolate....yum.

They also serve straus family ice cream (which I adore)...especially the Brown sugar Banana...omg.

When/If it gets warm....their Ice lollies are amazing as well....very unique flavors Blueberry/Zinfandel???  Peach/Riesling....really good.

They also serve Mitchells....but I would rather schleep to Mitchells for Mitchells.

They will Dip anything...and I mean anything in chocolate..

Try eating a dipped soft serve with one hand and walking a dog trying to chase a squirrel in the other hand......its my new talent.

check it out when  you are next in the park
author: David G.

description: A must-have for the kids on any day trip to Golden Gate Park. I enjoyed an avocado-line popsicle, but have enjoyed the dark chocolate dipped soft serve as well. They were nice enough to split a root beer float for us and the little ones love the topping choices, along with the novelty of an ice cream food truck. A great treat to end a day visiting the CA Museum of Sciences or botanical gardens.
author: Andrea E.

description:
Soft serve ice cream truck....what a bright idea!  Why didn't I think of that???  I really need to come up with the next brilliant idea so that I can ditch my 9-5 job.  In the meantime, at least I can enjoy Twirl and Dip and keep daydreaming! 

After spending an afternoon at the California Academy of Sciences, bf and I stumbled upon the Twirl and Dip truck while walking to our car through Golden Gate Park.  How could we not indulge in some pre-dinner ice cream?  I liked the choices that were on the menu and that they use natural/organic/quality ingredients in the ice cream.  It's like gourmet soft-serve with gourmet type toppings.  I always get a half and half swirl...best of both worlds so I went with the dark chocolate, vanilla on a cone.  Bf went with vanilla in a cup.  Somehow we ended up inhaling the soft serve ice cream shortly after getting into the car.  It was damn good.... not the type of froyo or soft serve you get that tastes completely like artificial flavoring.  You can tell that Twirl and Dip uses recipes that are well thought out and that their soft serve is made with some TLC.  Yum yum yum!!!
author: Liv A.

description: Definitely loved my vanilla bean swirl...but sad that the price went up to $5! I guess it's all part of the experience and worth it on a hot day at the park. Must try!
author: L H.

description:
When I was out in San Fran a year ago my friend told me about a magical soft serve ice cream truck that dishes out chocolate dipped cones with sea salt. I was buggin. I had to have some. Unfortunately the day we were to go it was raining and the Twirl and Dip truck did not make an appearance. SADNESS.

This year I was determined. I'd be dreaming about those cones all year long, after all. It was a fairly warm, sunny day and we made our way over to Golden Gate Park to get our ice cream on.

When we arrived I was overwhelmed. There were the aforementioned dipped cones but also ice cream sodas, popsicles, sundaes and more. I knew I had to get the cone but I also opted for the butterscotch ice cream soda. I'm a little bit crazy when it comes to sugar.

I watched the gal inside the truck make the soda. It was insane. I don't know what I was thinking but I was expecting the sheer magnitude of stuff that went into it. Multiple scoops of ice cream, soda water, and about half a bottle of butterscotch syrup, more ice cream, more soda, whipped cream, more butterscotch. I was like "Oh crap. What have I done." Luckily I was with 3 other people who were more than happy to help me polish that baby off. And it was gone pretty quickly. It is VERY sweet. If you like sugar and butterscotch definitely order this. If you're not big on sugar I would avoid at all costs. As I mentioned, I am big on sugar so I was in heaven. Buzzy, twitchy, delicious heaven.

The ice cream cone was a bit less intense but no less delicious. I ordered mine in a hand-made sugar cone. The cone was fantastic but if I'm being honest I probably wouldn't order it again, if only for the cleanliness factor. it tasted amazing but it was shaped in such a way that it made eating the ice cream a bit challenging. By the end I was a sticky mess and there wasn't really a place around for me to go wash my hands. The ice cream was smooth and creamy with a solid vanilla flavor to it. The chocolate was Tcho fair trade dark chocolate and sprinkled with Maldon sea salt. It was rich, not too sweet, and had a lovely salty crunch. I'm craving it just as I think about it.

I'm sad this truck doesn't exist near me in Michigan but with such delicious, sugary offerings maybe it's a good thing! ;)
author: Annette J.

description: Pretty pricey and small portion sizes, but the ice cream itself is quality. Lots of fun combinations to choose from!
author: Kayla S.

description:
Some soft serve after a long walk through Golden Gate Park is absolutely what my girlfriend and I needed to cool off and pack on some deliciously sweet calories.  I've seen their truck parked near the Academy of Science entrance for a while now and I figured it was high time to try it out.

There are quite a few treats to choose from but their swirl dipped cones with a dash or sea salt were what I wanted.  Once my girlfriend took the first nibble at hers however, I immediately regret my decision.  The problem is that the hot chocolate melts the ice cream and hardens in a thicker than normal shell, causing a lot of pressure to build before the inevitable explosion of soft serve out of the sides.  Before we knew it we were both covered in melted ice cream, and there was no napkins in sight.  The flavor of the soft serve was great, and I especially enjoyed the chocolate and sea salt.  However, considering the mess it makes, I don't think I would order it again.  The frozen banana is probably a better choice for me.

Service was pretty fast and friendly, and the line moves quickly.  Prices are on the high side so expect to pay about $5 per cone.  It's a convenient treat in the park and perfect for the Indian summer we're experiencing now.  Kids will love it, but parents will hate to clean it up.  Definitely get a treat, but proceed with caution when enjoying it!

Food: 7/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 8/10
author: Joe M.

description: The dark chocolate dip is really worth it, and the sea salt goes well with chocolate or it will be way too sweet. And best vanilla ever.
author: Pingyue W.

description:
Yum! Stopped by the truck this afternoon and got what they're known for - the vanilla/chocolate swirl soft serve with the TCHO dark chocolate dip. Cash only. 

My only regret is ordering it in a cup because some of the dip coated the inside of the bowl and when I tried to dig in to eat it, the paper came off attached to it and you dont want to eat dip with paper. 

I highly recommend ordering it in a cone. The soft serve will not fall off dont worry. It holds pretty well and takes a super long time to actually start melting a little so you'll be fine.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Wow!  I can't believe the number of times that I've walked by this ice cream truck parked near the Music Concourse in Golden Gate Park.   Today I decided to stop and give it a try.  I had a chocolate and vanilla twist for $3.75.
I asked for it to be dipped in dark Tcho chocolate for an additional $1.00.
It was excellent.  There are many homemade toppings to choose from in addition to all types of ice cream treats like floats, sundaes etc.
The sign on the truck says that they cater too.
author: Thomas D.

description: I've been here a few times over the years and there's very little on the menu that disappoints. I love their cones, especially the choco vanilla swirl. It's so hard to find non-fast food place soft serve so it's a great treat! Plus, no matter what fruit flavors they've hot at the time, the ice lollies covered in dark chocolate are so sweet and so yummy! Drop by and try as much as you can!
author: Stephanie R.

description: Amazing, spectacular ice cream! We got the vanilla bean chocolate swirl soft serve dipped in melted TCHO chocolate with a sprinkle of sea salt on top. It was heavenly! We also got the watermelon ice lollie which was absolutely delicious and so refreshing on a hot day in Golden Gate Park! You won't regret trying their ice cream :)
author: Diana F.

description:
Super yum! Perfect place to get your organic Ice Cream on while strolling through GG park.

I got the soft serve twist dipped in cho
chocolate with sea salt. Wow! Super intense and delicious. The chocolate is thick and rich and unlike any dip cone I have eve experienced! Super friendly kind staff. A little pricey but 100% worth it!
author: Anise N.

description: Coconut ice cream will blow your mind away!!!  Dipped in chocolate is good but a bit too much after a while but the coconut ice cream welllllll daaaammnnnn ! ...and it has coconut meat!
author: Gabby M.

description:
We came here after California Academy of Sciences. I love Straus Ice Cream! The staff members are extremely friendly. It was relatively quick. The dark chocolate covered option was quite good and it was not overly sweet. My best friend got the vanilla bean and chocolate twirl and my partner got the classic vanilla (as always). 
The price was pretty reasonable and will come back again!
author: George L.

description: What a treat in the middle of Golden Gate Park! Organic ice cream with great dark chocolate shell. The salt made it even better. The price was reasonable for being in the middle of the park and they even had vegan options. Cash only!
author: David C.

description: I've been heard of this for a long time and finally found it at golden gate park! After trying that ice cream cone with dipping, it is worth of every penny I spent on! Ice cream is organic, and it has sea salt added on dipped come which add more flavor onto that cone! Super awesome! Tip is this food truck is cash only!
author: Nina H.

description:
I had the vanilla chocolate twirl dipped in TCHO chocolate with the sea salt. Oh-SO-Yum. 

The highlight was the chocolate dip and sea salt. I do not like the usual hard crunchy chocolate dip. This one was thick and gooey, just the way I like it. The salt added the right amount of additional flavor to it. 

My husband got just the twirl. We agreed the one with the dip and the sea salt was better. 

After hours of walking in the park, this ice cream was exactly what we were looking for.
author: Pavithra R.

description:
Usually I would never condone purchasing a cone for more than 5 bucks, but the soft serve at Twirl and Dip made me believe that ice cream fairies were cradling me in a silky chocolate hug every time I bit into the velvety dipped soft serve!

Twirl and Dip is a cute little ice cream food truck in golden gate park that serves soft serve, Mitchell's ice cream, sundaes, floats, and fruit pops. They are known for their amazing dark chocolate dipped, organic soft serve cones. While the vanilla bean soft serve was creamy, smooth and all that jazz, the dark chocolate shell with sea salt was so, so amazingly exceptional and is a must try. 

The onlyyyyy reason why this isn't an all star 5 review is that again, it's pretty darn pricey.  If you want the whole shebang I think it's like 7 bucks, which is practically a crime. 

BUT I KILL FOR ICE CREAM.

Besides, anything that makes me hallucinate deserves a golden star on my list!
author: Kero D.

description: The ice lollies are bomb! I wanted the ice cream but I have diabetes so the nice guy suggested the lollies instead.
author: Therese S.

description:
As if the sight of food trucks weren't enough, you sell ice cream? Welp, thanks a lot for ruining my diet, Twirl and Dip! 

The 'thing' to get is their chocolate-dipped soft serve BUT they also have healthier options such as a fruit popsicle or a frozen banana, which, for an extra dollar, you can also dunk in chocolate. I got myself the Watermelon White Pepper popsicle and it was yummy! Not super guilt-inducing and very juicy. My boyfriend had the vanilla bean dunked in chocolate with a little bit of sea salt and of course, it was tasty. Didn't really like that when you bit into it, the soft serve inside just squirted and oozed out like it was already melted. 

I wouldn't say this was the best thing I've ever had and it's a bit on the pricey side, but it surely hits a good spot for me so overall, not bad!
author: Krissy L.

description:
We stumbled across this ice cream truck in Golden Gate park the other weekend. Since it was amazingly hot and ice cream sounded delicious, we got in line for soft serve. There's so few places that have good soft serve ice cream in the city, I was so excited to get one here. To make it even more awesome, they have chocolate *and* chocolate vanilla swirl (the latter being my favourite). To add decadence to your yummy dessert, you can add chocolate dip (Tcho chocolate), sea salt flakes, waffle cone, and a whole mess of toppings from candy to chocolate to fruit. There's also iced fruit popsicles if you want to avoid dairy but still crave a cool treat in the heat.

The line up at the time wasn't too bad, the service was a bit eh, but the ice cream made it worth waiting for.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
The service is quick and the vanilla chocolate twirl dipped in TCHO chocolate and sprinkled with sea salt was absolutely deloycious (that's how I like to spell it)!

I'll admit, I was expecting a bit more twirl for the price ($4). But hey, I still thought it was worth it! Especially since one of the workers was nice enough to entertain my mom's sudden weird obsession with smart cars and take her out on a mini joy ride!

Overall, I definitely recommend for the fast service and super friendly staff!
author: Eric V.

description: Stopped by this ice cream truck while strolling through golden gate park. Got the toffee crunch sundae with a bunch of toppings to share with my boyfriend but it was really sweet! It was a little tough for the both of us to finish. And it was a bit overpriced :( I saw lots of people getting soft serve dipped in tcho chocolate which looked really amazing.. The chocolate looked really rich and fudgey! I'll be trying that next time I see this truck :)
author: Victoria C.

description:
We went out of our way to stop by this place on a hot Sunday.  There was quite a line, but it was moving quickly and I wasn't about to let a little delay stop me.

This place can get pricey, the basic soft serve is $3.50, add $1.50 to get it dipped in TCHO chocolate (which is pretty necessary), and if you are a glutton like me then you'll want the sugar cone (basically a waffle cone) for $1.50.  My treat was $7 but I loved every second of it.

Perfect treat on a hot day (or any day really, because who doesn't love soft serve?).
author: Michelle K.

description: I love coming here!! The guy working in the truck is super friendly. I personally love the ice lollies but my bf is all about the vanilla soft serve dipped in tcho chocolate. Little pricey but understandable for a great product. Keep up the good work guys!
author: Ligia J.

description: Disappointing. Was told because I was the first customer today, my ice cream wasn't as good - I asked for a vanilla-chocolate twirl and it was mostly vanilla, with very little chocolate. The chocolate had little flavor, and the ice cream was watery. It was a very small cup for 5 ounces, and they served it with a soup spoon - I asked if they had smaller spoons and then she gave me a normal sized spoon. Somehow the unfriendly service and uninspiring soft serve made me realize that they only care about your wallet. Not a great feeling.
author: Buddha B.

description:
Chocolate dipped twirl with toffee chips and almonds... Do it!  The best thing about this treat is the hard, thick Tcho dark chocolate coating.  When paired with toffee chips and sea salt... Oh damn!  

Be ready to order a second cone...
author: MTBer I.

description:
Twirl and dip makes you feel like it's summer with their cones. 

It's easy to write off the simple vanilla dipped cone as nothing special, but the actual vanilla bean specks, smooth chocolate dip, and fresh sugar cone was a next level ice cream experience. On a warm Sunday in the park, expect a line, but know it's worth the wait. :)
author: Kitt V.

description:
Can't believe it took me so long to finally try them...but then again now that I have much more free time, that's probably why!

Organic vanilla soft serve dipped in TCHO chocolate with fancy salt. AMAZING!!! And perfect for all the great weather we've been having in SF lately!
author: Kristen C.

description:
It was freezing outside but when I saw this truck and it's menu....I was sold.

I bought a vanilla bean cone and had it chocolate dipped (with some sea salt) for an extra dollar. Free rainbow sprinkles was an option so I took it.

Service was nice but kind of slow. I don't think it's because of the workers though. I'm thinking that each cone/serving takes time to make (somehow). I'm not sure how their machines work, but their soft serve is nothing like any other soft serve you may have had before. 

The chocolate dip was amazing. Thick chocolate coating. Totally decadent TCHO realness. The added bit of sea salt added some dimension to it. Loved it. 

I'm never the type to get sprinkles, but these were just the cutest. A wonderful option to have since it was pride week. 

The soft serve was creamy and delicious. Impressive vanilla flavor. Authentic, smooth, delightful.

Recommend.
author: Sofia R.

description: I tried their vanilla bean-chocolate twirl dipped cone with a sprinkle of sea salt and it was amazing!! I loved how the chocolate is fairly thick and chewy versus just a thin layer....The ice cream was delicious and tasty and the guys running the truck were super friendly! The price was pretty decent for such a big cone. The only complaint I have is that the chocolate shell doesn't do a great job of encasing the ice cream and it can end up being a big mess when you take a bite....but otherwise this place is pretty awesome
author: Kelly Y.

description:
Holy crap this place is BOMB! 

I stopped by with a friend when the truck was at the 9th ave entrance of GGP. It was a pretty chilly day so there were only a few people in line. 

I ordered the Pralines and Cream Sundae -- organic vanilla soft serve, pralines, butterscotch sauce, and whipped cream. Yuuuuummmmmyyyy. My 6 oz. bowl was devoured in like 5 minutes... I really should have savored it, but it was too freaking delicious! Can't wait to be back to try the other treats.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Really disappointed after reading the glowing reviews on Yelp. I did like the organic sugar cone, but the ice cream itself was nothing special. Sort of tasted like watered down chocolate ice cream. Cost way too much for what you get. I've had better soft serve ice cream at the San Jose Flea Market!

I will not be going back.
author: C B.

description:
Mmmmmmm watermelon and white pepper.. Soo good!

We came here a sunny day after our visit to the California Science Museum.

I am no fan of regular ice cream, so naturally I chose the iced fruity lollipop watermelon with white pepper. It was so delicious! Just perfect with a natural taste of fruit.

Enjoyed it very much!
author: Maria E.

description: OMG SOOO GOOD! Get a cone and MAKE SURE TO DIP IT! Tcho chocolate makes all the difference. And if you want to level up, ask for sea salt on your ice cream. It's high quality ice cream (vanilla bean all the way) with a thick, soft layer of amazing high quality tcho chocolate. I've had many a dipped cone before but this is hands down the most amazing one I've had! Plus the guy who works there is really nice and happy- good service is always a plus! Can't wait to go back again!
author: Ruth Y.

description: I will dream of these sugar cones for the rest of my life. One of the best things I tried in SF. Go for the tcho. Well worth it. What an awesome stumble upon :)
author: Mei L.

description:
I have NEVER had ice cream like this!!! Never it is utterly amazing! The taste and omg that chocolate dip is so out of this world! Amazing quality you can see and most definitely taste!

Their chocolate is not like that cheap crunch flaky stuff most of the ice cream trucks have, this stuff is thick has a bite but then ooey gooey melts in your mouth! Amazing!!! I'm lactose intolerant and still could handle this sucker! Love love love!!!

Brought my bro in law and his wife along with my hubby to the truck after our day at GG Park. Talk about ending it on a WOW!!! They're from Hawaii and can't wait to get some when they come back!!!!

Highly recommended! Wonder if they cater? Bravo T&D y'all got something here pretty amazing!!

Great service too!
author: Bahvee V.

description: Mitchell's might be the best pistachio ice cream I've had yet. Served out of a cute little ice cream truck in Golden Gate Park after a day at the de Young is totally the cherry on top.
author: Jessica O.

description:
Okay, who doesn't love a cute ice cream truck in beautiful SF?? 

My boyf and I take my bark-a-lot dog for walks around this part of the park every once in a while and always stop at this truck whenever they're open. I'm not exaggerating at all, but I live and will die for their sugar cone. It's just really, really good. I've also had their soft serve but I'm perfectly okay with good ol' Mitchell's. Also love how they put chocolate chips at the bottom of the cones!

My boyf has had their Coke float but it was just kinda too messy to deal with while walking so we both just stick to sugar cones and Mitchell's!
author: Kathryn Y.

description: Spent a day at golden gate park with my family and so of course we had to enjoy and ice cream cone! The concept of it is great and the ice cream is good. The dark chocolate was a little think for my taste but it was great quality chocolate. I don't think the ice cream was the best I've ever had (that would be Tara's in the east bay or fossilmens in Alhambra, ca) but it was a perfect way to end our day in the park.
author: Jeanette M.

description:
Quite the fudge-tastic experience!

My friend and I just happened to stumble past a giant line and had to see what the hub bub was all about. We were sold immediately on the idea of TCHO chocolate drizzled all over a soft serve cone.

After pimping out our waffle cone with choco-drizzle, sea salt, and toffee bits, we walked back over to the park area and enjoyed one of the most sugar coma inducing experiences ever.

Must-try if you're looking to fully complete a day in Golden Gate Park.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Twirl and Dip is a new soft serve ice cream truck, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/twirl-and-dip-san-francisco?select=ckOelfkxWLhFp9Q7tcP54w#ckOelfkxWLhFp9Q7tcP54w that made a double OTG debut last Thursday at the OTG:UN Plaza (lunch time) and OTG:Upper Haight (evening) events. Next stop this week, the truck will be at OTG:McCoppin on Saturday evening. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/twirl-and-dip-san-francisco?select=fLMVOhjnhZ4T29Mt2-V-9A#fLMVOhjnhZ4T29Mt2-V-9A Check Twitter or Facebook for location updates.

Owners Meg H. and Siri S. also operate a separate cart filled with fruit-sicles and ice cream sandwiches, at a yet to be determined location. So customers will soon have twice as many chances of finding these sweet frozen treats, which are also available for catering.

On the menu: soft serve ice cream ($3.50-$4), fruitsicles ($3-4), root beer floats ($4.50), ice cream sandwiches ($4.50) and sundaes (50 cents first topping, 25 cents for each additional). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/twirl-and-dip-san-francisco?select=k5sYBASQxeXCbyzRz3wkfg#k5sYBASQxeXCbyzRz3wkfg

I bought a vanilla chocolate twist soft serve, served in a pizzelle-like handmade cone ($4). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/twirl-and-dip-san-francisco?select=0-QFToASDAy738vWZMDvug#0-QFToASDAy738vWZMDvug It was refreshing and delicious! nice chocolate flavor. Perfect remedy for a hot day.

** Update:
Since 2011 this ice cream truck can be found in Golden Gate Park (on Martin Luther King drive) Tue-Sun @ Noon to 7pm. It's parked on the corner, before the right turn into Music Concourse drive and the Academy of Sciences parking garage. Check Twitter or Facebook for schedule changes (due to weather or private catering jobs).
author: Luis C.

description: Super delicious on a hot spring day. There was a very long line, but it was worth the wait. A spot parked with the other food trucks off the road would have been better as we stood for 20 minutes by the exhaust of all the traffic going by. Great product though! Everyone in the family enjoyed it and once we got to the window service was very quick.
author: Maria M.

description:
3.75

I am totally a fan of soft serve so when I saw them while walking around Golden Gate park, I couldn't resist.  Looks like they have a permanent spot near the Academy of Sciences and Shakespeare Park.  

A variety of frozen treats from soft serve, scooped ice scream, popsicles, floats, and sundaes.  Their topping list is pretty good.  I went with a chocolate soft serve dipped with sea salt.  Simple, delicious, and loved the salt!

A bit pricey, but was definitely satisfying!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Fascinating Jean Paul Gaultier Exhibit @ the de Young + Long Lines + Pastel Colored Soft Serve Ice Cream Truck Nearby + 

Organic Vanilla Bean Soft Serve with a TCHO Dark Chocolate Shell + An Elegant Doily-like Homemade Sugar Cone = 

A RARE AFTERNOON TO MYSELF
author: Amy C.

description: Ehh. Shared their honey comb sundae with my BF and for $8, we'll past next time. The sundae was good at first but got exponentially sweet after each bite. There was maybe really only about half of cup of soft serve and then it was loaded with fudge, chocolate chips, and honey comb crisps. Overall the price wasn't really justifiable for the product. Don't get me wrong, I'm always more than willing to spend money on frozen desserts but this was just not worth it to me. The wait was also ridiculous.
author: Samantha C.

description:
The butterscotch sauce sundae with toasted almonds and whipped cream was delicious! It was a little pricey at $4.50, but for being local, organic, and hand-made you can't go wrong!

Gotta try their fresh fruitsicles and ice cream sandwiches next time!

FYI: they're at Marina Green Drive @ Scott on Wed, Fri, Sat, and Sun. Golden Gate Park on MLK Drive & 7th Ave on Tues and Thurs. Both locations from 12 noon until dusk!

Cash only!
author: Fallon P.

description: Vanilla dipped in chocolate and some sea salt sprinkled ontop?!? What more is there to say?! Actually.. Super worth it even on a cold day, because the ingredients they're using are top notch.. Esp noticed the fact the chocolate layer is slightly thicker and holds up so much better then any dipped ice cream I've ever had! Yum!
author: Heather A.

description: None of the tastes here were very unique. Regular soft serve with toppings that weren't super impressive. Pricey at $8 for a "sundae" which was a cup with some soft serve and whipped cream. Not bad by any means but it's ice cream so you can't really mess it up. The help was friendly and it's conveniently located if you're at the park. Those are benefits. Compared to a regular ice cream truck that just gives you packaged bars it's obviously better, but for the cost and the expectations that come with food trucks nowadays I expected better.
author: Adam B.

description: I got the vanilla bean and chocolate twirl dipped in dark chocolate with toasted almonds on a cone, it was very good. Can't say I haven't had better, but this was pretty good ice cream. However, the line to get ice cream was really long and moved very slowly (probably took around 30 minutes). Also, the ice cream itself isn't all that cheap. On the bright side, the employees working on the truck were very friendly and easygoing! Don't know how the actual store is, but id have to give it a try! Overall, I wouldn't want to wait on that line again for the ice cream, but if the line is short, I would say go for it, or try the store.
author: Steven P.

description: This ice cream was so delicious!! Came across the truck, while hanging out in Golden Gate Park. Decided to grab some soft serve ice cream! I got the vanilla bean- chocolate swirl, dipped in chocolate, with toasted almonds. My boyfriend got the same ice cream just dipped in sprinkles. The dark chocolate on top of the ice cream is very flavorful and thick! The flavor of the ice cream itself is super yummy! Worth the $12 we payed! This was such an awesome food and definitely one to come back to!!
author: Julia K.

description:
The chocolate dip here alone is worth the $5+ you pay for the softserv. The guy just has a hot cauldron of melted Tcho chocolate, and when applied to the ice cream, it's so thick and rich, it's absolutely THE BEST chocolate dip I've ever had!

I LOVE softserv, and the stuff here is pretty good. Not super sweet, nice texture. You just must get it chocolate dipped! Other than that, it's an ice cream truck in the park, pretty easy to love.
author: Dave Y.

description: This ice cream soft serve truck is truly a gem and worthwhile to travel out to at Golden gate Park parked out there at noon. Please check their website for what days they are there. It has great quality homemade, organic taste with Strauss Family Creamery milk from Petaluma,CA. I have made repeat visits just ordering the soft Serve. I ordered the Vanilla Bean / Chocolate Twirl and paid extra $1.25 for the worthwhile handmade sugar cone. And boy is it worth the extra $1.25 because I never went back to a regular cone. This sugar cone is the bomb! And I mean that in a good way! Yummy in my tummy! So my total cost was $5.25. There is always a line in front of the truck and people are very happy and excited when they get their ice cream. All the smiling faces everywhere. And is a great location for tourists and locals alike to just swoop in there and enjoy a nice ice cream frosty on a nice hot day or cold day, whichever you prefer. :-)
author: Priscilla L.

description: All ice cream trucks should aspire to be as awesome as Twirl and Dip. I sometimes plan my weekend jogs in the park to end at Twirl and Dip to treat myself to a reward of vanilla soft serve dipped in Tcho chocolate and sprinkled with sea salt. There was one sad time that I did this and they had run out of soft serve by the time I finished my jog :( At ~$6 per dipped cone, it's a little pricey, but WELL WORTH IT. I appreciate how this truck is faithfully in the park every day in the same location bringing a little piece of happiness to everyone that stops by.
author: Alice H.

description:
Such good ice cream, I don't even know where to begin. I got the standard, simple, no-gimmicks vanilla soft serve cone. You know it's good, true vanilla when you can see the black vanilla bean specks in it (applies to all desserts btw).

I liked their soft serve because it wasn't too soft-- it reminded me of the texture of 'chewy' Turkish ice cream (the ones that they batter around in a ice box and serve it to you on long metal sticks). Is it cuz it's organic milk used? I'm not sure. Anyway, it's great, had I had more cash I would've definitely gotten the chocolate coating, which looked divine.

Definitely recommend!
author: Jessica Y.

description:
I first heard about this through friends who are fellow dessert lovers. We passed by it coincidentally on a walk one day and even though I was stuffed from lunch, they successfully forced me to try it. I was glad they did. 

On my friends' recommendation, I ordered the vanilla soft serve dipped in tcho chocolate and sprinkled with sea salt, atop a regular sugar cone. At 5-fifty-somethin, this is a pretty damn good ice cream cone. The soft serve itself is good quality - smooth with a light vanilla taste. In the shell, I enjoyed sincere chocolate notes; there wasn't any old cocoa bean business, or excess sugar to make up for poor flavor. The sea salt added its familiar savoury complement to the creamy sweetness of the ice cream and chocolate. With this balance of flavor, my palate felt wholly satisfied and needed no cleanser.
author: Michelle J.

description:
Vanilla waffle cone ice cream with cacao bits with a pinch of sea salt  

Usually you'll find a long line here, but it's worth waiting for.
author: Javier P.

description: 4 stars for the chocolate, 2 stars for the vanilla. I purchased a cup of soft serve ice cream over the weekend, and asked for both flavors, but not swirled. Unfortunately, I had the vanilla on the top and I didn't like it at all. It tasted fake-y to me for some reason, even though I could see the vanilla beans in the soft serve. Maybe it was too much vanilla bean and/or the flavor and the consistency (it was a teensy bit grainy)? However, my friends seemed to enjoy it so it might just be my palate. The chocolate on the other hand was delicious! Very rich and satisfying tasting, and perfectly creamy. Next time I'll have to splurge on a chocolate dipped soft serve! The truck also serves Fruitsicles, Mitchell's ice cream, and STRAUS Family Creamery ice cream (a must try if you haven't had their ice cream before!).
author: Amy D.

description:
Food trucks are popular because you usually get a yummy tasting item for an awesome price because their cost overhead is significantly lower than restaurants. 

Came here after the De Young, there was a little line, but it moved quickly. The people working were nice and I ordered a cup of vanilla chocolate swirl. 

It was a tiny cup for four dollars, definitely not worth it. Fraiche and loving cup are tastier and a better bang for your buck. I don't think I would come back and am bummed because I don't want to throw it away but don't want to eat it either.
author: Jenny T.

description: The smell of the handmade sugar cones is what attracted me to the ice cream truck. Everything on the menu sounded amazing! There was a bit of a line but the one man working did an excellent job keeping the line going fast. I got the cantaloupe frozen fruit pop that was delicious and my boyfriend got the dipped soft serve and talked about how delicious it was all night. One of the best food trucks I have ever been to!
author: Erica D.

description:
I have long waxed nostalgic for soft ice cream, which seems to have been hounded from ice cream trucks by the easier-to-manage packaged ice cream treats. So the idea of artisanal soft ice cream sounded like a can't miss!

We went for the classic option: a vanilla-and-chocolate swirl with a chocolate dip. I opted for the fleur de sel sprinkles on my (high quality dark chocolate) dipped cone, and sprang for the handmade sugar cone (which added $1.25 to the price, as I recall).

Here's the sad truth: soft ice cream just isn't anywhere near as good as hard, scooped ice cream. (Twirl and Dip offers that too, but the soft ice cream seems to be their main thing.)

And here's the even sadder truth: the crappy chocolate dip you got from the ice cream truck of your youth is actually better than the high-quality dark chocolate dip you can get from T&D. The old-skool dip turns into a very thin shell that cracks, giving your ice cream a nice crunchy texture. The high-quality dip turns into a very thick shell that is chewy and overwhelms the ice cream. I was very glad I had the fleur de sel sprinkles, which mitigated the sweetness.

The sugar cones were excellent, and made me very glad we ponied up the premium price. But the way they are rolled leaves a big valley for the soft ice cream to dribble out of, so these were way, way messier than any other ice cream cone we had during our trip (more than a dozen!) So be very cautious about getting a cone if you are wearing anything you want to keep ice-cream free, or if you're not certain you'd recognize your child once he is coated with a layer of melted cream.

Also, it's an extraordinarily slow ordering process -- not sure why. There was only one 4-person family in front of us in line, but it took about 15 minutes for us to get our ice cream cones. So if there were any line at all, I'd give this a miss.
author: Alexandra S.

description:
$4 dip cone. Portion small equivalent to a child scoop in other places. 
$1.50 if you want sugar cone
$1.50 if you want chocolate coating
$.50 per extra optional topping
It's easy to spend $6+ on a single scoop cone.

The chocolate shell was very thick. I estimate the heat from it caused my softserve to melt extremely fast. It was dribbling as it was handed to me. Forced to wolf it down in record time. Observing others in the vicinity, they're all having the same problem. I would reconsider getting the chocolate coating again.

No doubt it's all organic hand petted goodness. I didn't find the vanilla to to particularly flavorful although vanilla bean specks were clearly visible. It wasn't particularly creamy. Still puzzled why food truck food is more expensive than brick and mortar equivalents.
author: John H.

description:
This was such a nice dessert to eat while walking around the Academy of Sciences. I did not expect the ice cream soft serve to be so creamy and delicious and it was definitely the best soft serve I have ever had even though it came from a truck! The vanilla was just perfect and the you could literally taste the flavor of the coco beans and not only this but it was organic! 

Make sure to try this out! Best ice cream truck I have ever been to. You will not be unsatisfied :)
author: Audrey C.

description: Cute little ice cream truck that parks near the Science museum in Golden Gate Park. The menu is hard to read and it's a little overpriced. I got a chocolate soft serve ice cream come with rainbow sprinkles and loved it, but it wasn't mind-blowingly special. I love nearly all ice cream that I consume. The best part was the location. The was a long line but at the time, ice cream really hit the spot.
author: Bridgett W.

description: Best Rootbeer Float around! So delicious. I have to stop myself from going every week.
author: Audra H.

description:
I couldn't believe my eyes when I came across Twirl & Dip on Sunday afternoon at the corner of Martin Luther King Jr. Drive and Middle Drive East in Golden Gate Park. This is one of their two permanent locations.  Golden Gate Park on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays from 1p to 7p. Marina Green on Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 1p to 7p.

This food truck offers local, organic, sustainable treats. They make their soft serve using Strauss Farm Creamery products, they also have hand made floats, milkshakes, sundaes with locally grown fruit toppings, fresh cookies and fruitsicles.

I enjoyed their chocolate and vanilla bean soft serve. Since soft serve ice cream is one of my favorites, I shall return. Hooray for gourmet food trucks!

PS: Check their site for the latest updates and menu:

http://twirlanddip.com/
author: Cathy K.

description: I found this ice cream truck out of pure luck and oh my god! They have taken the traditional dip cone and have made it much much better. I could not believe the line out front of this truck, but obviously, that means I have to try it. I had always grown up eating dipped cones at theme parks and that had been my only exposure to them and they were alright. After trying a dipped cone here I walked away with a newfound love of them and hope to visit this truck again when I am in San Francisco!
author: Aron H.

description: Very cute soft serve ice cream truck, $4 for soft serve, sprinkle with sea salt on top of the chocolate is the perfect compliment! Eat it on the bench and take a romantic stroll inside Shakespeare garden.
author: Suzzie B.

description:
I love chocolate dipped cones and will have one any chance I get. I couldn't find Twirl and Dip the first time since I thought it would be parked near the other trucks like Sam's Chowdermobile in the concourse between museums. But it is nearby parked on MLK. 

They use TCHO chocolate to dip and I actually prefer this texture which is a bit thicker and gummier than Super Duper's version which cracks easily. Sea salt is a nice touch. It is quite melty but it takes me 2 minutes to inhale anyway. What a treat after a long run through the park.
author: Mimi L.

description:
The truck is often parked near the Music Concourse. I see it often, standing there, tempting me.

I broke down and got a cone of vanilla, chocolate dipped, with sea salt sprinkles. It was everything I hoped it would be. A bit more actually, because that TCHO chocolate blew the pants off of my childhood memory of Fosters Freeze dipped cones. 

If you care anything for chocolate dipped cones, you will do yourself a favor and indulge. Get some napkins and maybe a wet wipe too because that stuff doesn't fight gravity too well.
author: Loli L.

description: Hired the truck for our wedding- they did such a fantastic job, it was the highlight of our wedding for all our guests!
author: Lindsay T.

description:
Beware - they close at 5:30p now (fall/winter hrs?). So sad... we arrived at 5:39'ish... FROM Oakland... yes, we drove over the bridge for twirl n' dip... bcuz YES it's that good. Wish I could say it wasn't, bcuz I'm irritated that they were closed (and hrs weren't changed on yelp) BUT I cannot lie. The young woman who was working there felt bad and said if we waited she would get the soft-serve machine started... but then we felt bad that they'd have to do that for us. 

My fave (that I will dream about tonight) - the toffee sundae... MMMMmmmmm... creamy, smoothy swirled soft serve... dark chocolate sauce, caramel sauce... topped with delicious toffee and lightly sprinkled with coarse salt. omfg. bathe me in it.

My love gets the dark chocolate dipped cone sprinkled with salt. She LOVES it! She's incredibly particular about her ice cream/soft-serve! Trust her, people.

So again... twirl n' dip you broke our hearts but WE WILL return. And now we take the long journey back over the bridge.
author: Ms. B.

description:
Some of the best softserved ice cream! The dipped chocolate was dark and so decadent! Its really the best part of the dessert. *HIGHLY RECOMMEND*
The price was about $6 for each cone and cash only.
author: Jaclyn N.

description: Best soft serve ice cream! The dark chocolate dip is soft and luscious! Get salt for a real treat!
author: Pamela M.

description:
Delicious. Got two scoops of coffee ice cream, a dark chocolate drizzle (which became a thick shell) with a pinch of sea salt on top, which made it taste even more incredible. 
Would have been 5 stars if he didn't sprinkle the sea salt with his bare, money-handling hands haha
author: Karen S.

description:
As we were walking into Golden Gate park for our 6th month anniversary picnic, we saw an ice cream truck...but it wasn't open yet. My bf was so disappointed that our appetites couldn't be ruined by ice cream; I told him that if it was open later on as we were leaving the park, we could get some ice cream. 

Although the line was only like 5 people, it still took us a while to get to the front and order the ice cream. We got a soft serve twirl in a homemade sugar cone, the Sunday sundae special, and some chocolate dipped pretzel rods. 

The soft serve in the homemade sugar cone ($5.00) was really good. My bf decided on the vanilla and chocolate twirl. The vanilla outshined the chocolate which never really happens for me. The vanilla tasted like vanilla bean and it was so good. The chocolate was a lot less delicious, but still pretty good. If I were to try this place again, I would totally get a vanilla bean soft serve in a sugar cone. The sugar cone was delicious!

The Sunday sundae special ($6.00) was ice cream, banana slices, almonds, toffee brittle, toasted almonds, whipped cream, chocolate sauce and a cherry on top.
