It said that it would have butterscotch sauce too, but I didn't remember it on my sundae. I got it with the two different ice creams as well, but the whole thing was a mess when I started eating it. The cherry was not that good since it was not one of those maraschino cherries, but like a sour one, but everything else was really good. I enjoyed the different things all in one bite. 

The pretzel rods ($1.50) were not that amazing. I personally don't like the combination of salt and sweet. Not my personal favorite. 

I was very interested in the floats and fruitsicles they had there as well, but I couldn't have everything...they would have melted, surprising in a San Francisco April day. I hope I see their truck again sometime on Sunday when we meander around the park looking for an adventure!
author: Nina Y.

description:
Major sanitation fail!!!

 I watched him handle money then make our ice cream cones. He sorted through a bag of sugar cones, dipped mine and chocolate and used the same dirty hands to sprinkle salt. Did not wash his hands, did not use a napkin or anything.  Considering cash and coins are probably the dirtiest thing we touch that is major basic sanitation issue. Makes me wonder what other corners are cut!  I had a bite of my girlfriends ice cream to try and it was good. But not interested in trying that place again after witnessing such a basic issue. Disgusting.
author: Michael L.

description:
Seeing this truck makes me do a happy dance. Hmm... what my friends say about me is true: when I love something, I REALLY love it. 

I don't even really know how to put into words how awesome this is. I get the Chocolate-Vanilla swirl, dipped in TCHO chocolate, with the sea salt. I never used to be so into soft-serve, but man, do these people know how to do soft-serve. 

Eating tip: I like to bit the top off, and then suck out the ice cream. But you know, you can do whatever you want. Your face will get a little messy either way, but whatevs. Makes you feel like a kid again. 

I've only been able to have this twice, but this truck is worth tracking down. Also, I've always encountered a line, but that's what living in San Francisco is all about... Spending half your life here standing in a line for something. It's been maybe a 10-15 minute wait every time, but don't be dissuaded: it's totally worth it. 

Bring cash. About $5 should do it. 

Maybe I'll try to branch out next time. But I'm really into the organic soft-serve. Yum!
author: Jia min C.

description: Really solid tasting soft serve and high quality tcho chocolate. If there are three people ahead of you plan on waiting about ten minutes if they all don't know what they want.
author: Christian H.

description: This truck definitely deserve 5 stars. The person working the truck was incredibly kind and I highly enjoyed my Root Beer Float which I recommend to all who ever reads my review. My friend also got the Watermelon Popsicle, and she also said it was very good. Good experience. Absolutely nothing bad to say.
author: Hannah E.

description:
I went today with my friend to try this ice cream truck. 

I got the vanilla and chocolate swirl with a handmade sugar cone.

Price:$5.25

My thoughts: The sugar cone crispy and the soft ice cream was good on the bottom of the cone there were chocolate chips. The ice cream does melt pretty fast.

My friend had the vanilla and chocolate swirl  dipped with TCHO with sea salt in a cup.

Her thoughts: Too much chocolate and a little bit of sea salt. She liked the vanilla bean ice cream.

Price: $5.25

Next time I would try the fruit lolli. The flavors sound good.
author: Irene L.

description:
The first time I saw this truck was while I was driving on the freeway. I gunned my car to see what the truck was since I had never seen it before. 

I never seem to catch the truck at a good time. It was either too cold, I was too full or on my way to dinner do I didn't want to ruin my appetite. Well, today was a good day. A perfect day. The weather was beautiful and I had great company. We stopped by on an evening stroll through Golden Gate Park. There were so many choices, but I stuck to the ever popular Chocolate Vanilla Twirl Dipped with Sea Salt Sprinkles. The chocolate dip was like no other. The dip was rich, the soft serve as smooth as silk and the sea salt help cut the sweetness. 

I made my way back the next day to try the fruitsicle. They ran out of Meyer Lemon, which I know I would have loved, so I had the Mandarin Blood Orange. It was really good, it hit the spot on a really hot day.
author: Adelina W.

description: After watching some 1886 Baseball (baseball in 1886 uniforms) this was the perfect treat. So creamy and yummy!!
author: Veronica R.

description:
Twirl & Dip is the closest thing to a fro-yo truck in the Bay Area (only they don't have fro-yo).  The truck serves up gourmet soft serve (two flavors, made with Straus organic milk), fruitsicles, ice cream sandwiches (soft serve or hard ice cream), malted milk shakes and sundaes.  
Soft serve flavors ($3.50): 

* Vanilla bean: it wasn't runny but it was softer than I expected (I'd like something firmer), creamy, rich, vanilla bean specks throughout, good but not wow good
* Sweet earth chocolate

Cones are freshly made ($1) and feature a pretty design, thicker and softer than the usual waffle cone, reminiscent of a buttery, softer fortune cookie.
author: Lolia S.

description: I was so excited to try this foodtruck and even happier when there was no line on a cloudy SF weeknight. I decided to go big or go home with their honeycomb dream sundae, erroneously thinking the honeycomb would be akin to the coffee crunch cake topping at Yasukoshi's. WRONG! Overpriced, the hard choco bits tasted something out of a generic Nestle bag, and the honeycomb was just crunchy and made my teeth stick together. For a froyo sunday, $8 is just too much to fork over. And it came out super slow!
author: Christine Y.

description:
We like to use public transit on sightseeing trips - meet folks, see the neighborhoods, cultural immersion, etc.   We asked someone for the best place to get off the bus for the SF Botanical Gardens.  Another rider told us, adding that the Twirl and Dip ice cream truck was THE place to make our visit perfect (parked on MLK Drive near the Music Garden,)

Homemade organic self serve ice cream in a handmade sugar cone.  Sounded great!  Our fellow rider/advisor added we had to get it dipped in dark, rich chocolate sprinkled with sea salt.  Sounded even better!

We wandered a bit to find it.  Our french vanilla bean & chocolate swirl cones were even better than the glowing description.  Cost: $4.75 ($3.75 without the dip).  Flavor: Priceless!
author: Larry S.

description: Twirl and dip in the golden gate park takes part on an ice cream truck.  The line is long and one person is running the operation so expect a wait.  The ice cream looks well done and is pretty.  They have a big variety of ice creams and Popsicles.  The ice cream itself is heaven, it's amazing it's creamy and a good chocolate dip is a good partner for it.  You should definitely try it if you haven't.
author: Talia R.

description: The best soft serve in SF!!  I love the vanilla and chocolate swirl!  I drove by it so many times and I can't believe I never stopped!
author: Angelene B.

description: So good!! We got free ice cream because of my aunties wedding. However the ice cream is delicious!!!! Especially the Oreo Cookie. It's chunks of Oreo
author: Ricardo G.

description:
Yummy yummy soft swirl!

The vanilla is sweet and tasty, while the chocolate is not overly sweet (feels more like a dark chocolate), so the 2 matches up perfectly. Their homemade sugar cone is lighter and yummier than the cardboard a lot of other places has.

Also they have plenty of toppings and other goodies. However, just their basic soft serve is already amazingly delicious

This is a tad above the normal ice cream truck!!
author: Alice C.

description:
Finally an ice cream truck for "adults"! 

I was still busy digesting a pork-heavy breakfast burrito when my bf pointed out the Twirl and Dip truck. After carefully weighing my options while also considering my body's occasional contempt of lactose, I opted for the lemon mint ice lolly. It was mouthwateringly refreshing but alas, it also melted away quicker than the polar ice caps and I was left holding a bare stick, feeling helpless with my sticky hands. 

The bf was smarter though and went for the deliciously decadent toffee crunch sunday (soft serve vanilla, dak chocolate sauce, butterscotch sauce, english toffee pieces, toasted almonds, whipped cream and a cherry on top).

After reading the other reviews, I'll be sure to try the chocolate-dipped soft serve sprinkled with sea salt. There were a few other interesting options available so it looks like I'll have to revisit several times. Oh well.
author: Elsa K.

description:
Their homemade butterscotch sauce is worth swimming across Lake Merritt for.
I had a sundae -- mixed chocolate and vanilla soft-serve with butterscotch, whipped cream and almonds.
Everything was good, however the chocolate seems to be missing a little bit of oomph ... maybe it's because they don't make it super sweet or something.
My son had the kiddie vanilla cone and he was crazy about it. Till now, he has thought that the concepts of "ice cream truck" and "Lake Merritt" equal that nasty cheap kind, with a bell and SpongeBob on a stick. 
Let's hope that by taking him to places like T&D I'm raising my kid right. On the way there, I said, "today you're gonna taste REALLY GOOD ice cream."
He said, "Mom there is no such thing as BAD ice cream."
author: Lisa T.

description:
Twirl and Dip is a local food cart/truck that debuted back in June as a guest of the food cart Seoul on Wheels in Emeryville. They are local and specialize homemade organic soft serve. According to their website they use the all famous Straus Family Creamery milk and cream in their soft serve, organic fair trade chocolate from Sweet Earth, Blue Bottle coffee, and seasonal fresh fruits and herbs from the many organic farmers in Northern California. Twirl and Dip also bakes all of their own baked goods and hand rolls their cones. The cones come in three different flavors: plain, milk, dark or white chocolate. Last but not least what makes them unique is they make their own Popsicles too. 

I got to check out their soft serve today while i was at the Nihonmachi Street Fair in Japantown today, they stood out because they were the only food cart/truck there. They were not very busy, I was guessing because they are not as well known as the other food carts/trucks in the city. This however didn't stop me from coming over to try it, what caught my eye was that they used organic ingredients and there soft serve is homemade.

They had 3 different soft-serve flavors today:

$4 for a reg cone or cup and handmade cones were $4.50 each.

-Vanilla Bean
-Sweet Earth Chocolate
-Chocolate Vanilla Twirl

Fruitsicles $3 each!

-watermelon
-nectarine 
-strawberry

A few other things they have are sundaes and they even have a mexican coke ice cream float


Lastly they also had a soft serve ice cream sandwich $5 bucks and ur pick of which soft serve you want!

I got one Vanilla Bean Soft Serve ice cream sandwich and a chocolate vanilla twist to share with the gf.  The vanilla Bean Soft Serve was in btw two delicious homemade chocolate chip cookies. The chocolate vanilla twirl was as the name suggested a mixture of chocolate and vanilla softserve swirled or twirled together.  Both were very smooth and creamy and had a real taste to it, you can tell that nothing artificial is put in it. 

You can find the Twirl and Dip truck by following them on twitter: http://twitter.com/twirlanddip

A suggestion i would like to make to the Twirl and Dip truck is to sign up for Off the Grid if they haven't already!!
author: Jonathan W.

description:
I was really excited to try this ice cream truck because I'm a big fan of the classic soft serve.  I decided to go all out and ordered the vanilla + chocolate twirl at $3.75 dipped in TCHO dark chocolate and sprinkled with sea salt +$1.  The cone felt pretty hefty because of the thick layer of chocolate encasing the soft serve.  Honestly, I was surprised the dip held up so well, but when I bit into it, I found the chocolate layer had a soft consistency between solid and gooey...like the first stages of melting on a hot day.  It was fun to bite in and slurp up the soft serve.  Don't mind the stares you'll get.  

In terms of taste, the chocolate was too overwhelming, and combined with the sea salt, overpowered the classic vanilla taste that I was craving.  Don't get me wrong, they use quality chocolate, but next time, I will stick to my usual vanilla soft serve.  Overall, it was fun to try a new style.  On a hot day, I think I'd like to try their fruit lollies.  I'll be back. :)
author: Renee L.

description: Vanilla in a fresh sugar cone with butterscotch syrup and sea salt - TRUST ME. GET IT. I've got many favorite ice cream places in the city but this combo trumps all.
author: Olivia H.

description:
While vacationing in San Francisco, my girlfriend and I took a cab to Golden Gate Park to visit the De Young museum and due to the high traffic got out and walked the last 1/4 mile.  En route we saw the Twirl and Dip truck and had to stop.

We were third in line and by the time we got to ordering, there about 10 people in line!  My girlfriend got an old fashion root beer float and I got a scoop of coffee on a cone.  We continued to the Spreckels Temple of Music to enjoy the Golden Gate Park Band!  Great way to start the afternoon!
author: David M.

description: What happened? You guys made a wrong turn. Been coming to your can in the park for years. I was looking forward to my vanilla bean cone today. What I got was a smaller cone and ice cream that had wax in it. Xantham gum or something that stuck to my gums. So sad.  Are you trying to cut back? Save money. What happened. I'm so sad.
author: Fran H.

description: Swirl and Dip ice cream was just the homemade treat I needed. I didn't want to leave Golden Gate Park and knew the truck was as usual parked on Martin Luther King, Jr. Drive... just beyond and south of the Academy of Sciences. I ordered a vanilla bean and chocolate soft serve dipped in dark chocolate. Perfect! Long lines form, so I felt lucky to order right away... Walked over to the bandstand concourse, sat, and relished my delish Swirl and Dip homemade ice cream. Yum!
author: Artemis R.

description: My sister and I were walking through the Botanical Gardens in SF and decided that ice cream sounded delightful despite the slight chill in the air. We yelped ice cream and this truck showed up less than a mile away. We ordered chocolate/vanilla twist cones; I choose the organic waffle cone. Delicious!!! We were very pleased.
author: Tianna H.

description:
Love Twirl and Dip!  A and I have visited three times and I just recently brought my 6yo niece.

We usually get the vanilla bean soft serve in a regular cone dipped in TCHO chocolate and sprinkled with sea salt.  $4.75

My niece got the kid-sized vanilla bean soft serve in a regular cone with rainbow sprinkles.  $3.00

If it's a nice day, the line is pretty long, but they move pretty quick.  

I absolutely love the TCHO chocolate dip, but sometimes they don't do it so well and there's a hole in the chocolate and my soft serve leaks out, causing a ginormous, leaky mess.  Still super tasty, but such a mess.

If you see Twirl and Dip, definitely stop by and treat yourself!
author: Kris L.

description: I like the organic soft serve ice cream dip it in dark chocolate. It has sea salt on chocolate, no so sweet, I like it!
author: Hui L.

description: This ice cream was such a treat! I recommend trying the sea salt on top of the ice cream!! Loved it!!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
They were in the Golden Gate Park, so I decided to try it out.

I had a spiced flavor soft serve. Yummy. From reading some of the reviews, I will need to try their home made cones.
author: Mandy D.

description:
Delicous, fun, and nostalgic. What's not to love? Saw the truck in Golden Gate Park one Friday afternoon and simply had to try it. The line was almost a deterrant, but preserverance paid off. 

Got the organic vanilla with the Tcho dark chocolate & sea salt dip, on a handmade sugar cone. Portion was very generous, and more than enough to share between two sweet-tooths like me and my companion. I could almost eat just the sugar cone by itself as it was delicate, buttery and almost cookie- like with the added surprise of dark chocolate at the tip. A sunny day in the park, eating this deliciousness, walking through the Rose Garden the perfect way to spend a Friday, non? 

Sometimes I see the truck parked around Lake Merritt, so next time,  I will be sure to try their sundaes or fruitsicles.
author: Kris R.

description:
Nutmeg ice cream in a Mexican Coke float...

...just a minute, I'm having a moment.  Ahhh, so refreshing. 

Organic soft serve ice cream, home made cookies for ice cream sandwiches, tons of sundae toppings made from scratch, fresh fruitsicles.  The ladies in this truck make great quality desserts.  And they hang out in Brisbane until the afternoon, when you're feeling like you need a snack to keep you going at work.  

I can't wait until this cold and rainy weather is gone and I'm again running after the ice cream truck.  This soft serve is worth running after.  Five stars because one day I tried to bring my kids after school to get some soft serve, but they just ran out so they gave us free cookies.

Now if only they had that ice cream jingle playing as they drive down the street.
author: Maria S.

description: I don't know who the genius was at Twirl & Dip who thought, "You know, olive oil is totally underutilized in the soft serve ice cream business...", but they deserve a medal.  If you like salty and sweet, give it a go and you will not be disappointed.
author: Katy R.

description: dude do it. sea salt awesome. knock out love it. busy eating it
author: Robert C.

description: Talk about quality, but pricey ice cream!  It's getting harder and harder these days to find good soft serve ice cream, (I guess you could consider that sentence a pun, I didn't intend to make it one though...) luckily, Twirl and Dip exists! After a good three to four hours of walking around the California Academy of Sciences, this is exactly what I needed. I got a cup of chocolate with chocolate sprinkles and was not disappointed. The lines can sometimes get long, but don't worry, it's worth the wait!
author: Michael G.

description: How many times did I spot the Twirl and Dip truck in GGPark from the 44?  And how many times did I want to pop off to check out the cool looking ice cream truck but time wasn't on my side to get off and trek back?  Finally, while visiting the De Young, I made my way over.  That trek was so worth it.  The 1st time I had to have the vanilla/chocolate twirl dipped in chocolate with the Maldon salt sprinkled on.  YUM!  Since then I've had the Straus Farm brown sugar banana and a tangerine fruitsicle. Double YUM!  Took the nieces today and they're hooked.  Each of us had a twirl but customized it to our own preference.  Triple YUM!
author: J. P.

description:
OMG I LOVE YOU!! it's seems so hard to find soft serve ICE CREAM in SF/ east bay. Am I right? 

Places like Ici and Tara's are great but they're not soft serve and sometimes i just crave it. 

T&D has great flavors (though their vanilla bean is a little too strong and the consistancy isn't as creamy as I like, and a little too soft) their mexican chocolate was great. You can tell it's homemade because of how quickly it melts (prolly no caragneen).
author: Layla L.

description:
This was absolutely amazing! One of the best ice creams I have had in a long time.

Boyfriend and I shared a vanilla bean dark chocolate dipped cone and I was in heavy. This place doesn't use that fake-y thin chocolate to dip your ice cream. It was THICK. I had a chocolate overload and I love chocolate.
author: Ash I.

description: Awesome dessert truck by the De Young Museum in Golden Gate Park. It seems like the lines are getting longer these days but it's totally worth the wait. My boyfriend and I tried to share a vanilla soft serve with chocolate dip/sea salt and handmade cone and we almost broke up. My only advice is to get your own. 5 stars all the way!
author: Julia T.

description: My dear God, why does my love have to be so far! I live in the northeast bay and it is quite the trek to get here--and worth it every time. Whenever I find myself near the Park in SF, I franticly run to Twirl and Dip in such a panic. I love to support businesses that are organic and food trucks have a certain charm--especially when chocolate is involved. I adore their dark chocolate dipped cones and I was so floored they have cocoa nibs as a topping! Love those! The time it takes to devour and savor a cone is so awesome. The chocolate shell is always thick and rich in almighty chocolatey-ness. It's all very gourmet here and oh so magical! They were open past their schedule as shown on Yelp and I knew it was meant to be (on my birthday no less, LOL). I think I should just have them come to me and my friends and cater my birthday next time. ;)
author: Aaron G.

description:
I can't even tell you how happy I was to see a soft serve ice-cream truck at the end of a long day of lacrosse and playing in the park with friends.

Not to mention: DARK CHOCOLATE WITH SEA SALT dipped soft-serve. It was just the most amazing thing I had ever tasted.

Thank you, Twirl and Dip. The only bummer is they only take cash, which I didn't have, so had to borrow money from a friend.
author: Natalie R.

description:
Yummy for my tummy! Twirl and dip was at my friend's wedding reception this past weekend. And it was such an unexpected surprise!! Now, I have had dip cones from various chain creameries, but none of them compare to Twirl and Dip's. The dark chocolate shell that surrounds the ice cream is so chocolaty rich and thick enough that it holds the ice cream on the cone perfectly. Not once did it crack before I sank my teeth into it. You can also have it sprinkled with sea salt if you want for added flavor. My hubby tried both flavors of their ice lollies: watermelon white pepper and strawberry. They looked like dark pink hockey pucks on a stick, ok really oversized lollipops, but totally refreshing and bursting with flavor. 

The two ladies that were serving were very friendly and kept smiling to the long line of guests until the very end. 

Absolutely delicious!
author: Charlene W.

description:
It was a crazy hectic stressful day at the office.  In my field we love a good crisis, but this was a day for a few good crisis too many.

Sucked into my computer screen I notice a pop-up alert sent from our Corporate Communications team: "Twirl and Dip Truck parked outside!"  

Of course I can't eat ice cream for lunch, but grateful I was reminded to eat.

In the elevator on the way back from our salad bar, I turn to see what's making the slurping sound echoing from the corner.

It is our new SVP.  She's hunched over in the corner gnawing away on a generous chocolate dipped cone completely unaware of the 6 additional people in the elevator gawking at her.  With chocolate syrup all over her chin and nose, ice cream dripping down her shirt and flecks of multi colored sprinkles in her hair I am reminded 1. How much I love working here 2. Why ice cream is better than salad.  

Promptly, I turn around and head out to the truck.

$6 later with a sugar cone of chocolate vanilla dipped swirl, I find myself in the corner of the elevator lost in the scrumptiousness of cold and warm and buttery crisp contrasted by rich thick chocolate and I think this must be what heaven tastes like....

The "ding ding ding" of the elevator reaching my requested floor kicks me out of my euphoric trance.  I realize I've got ice cream dripping down my floral blouse, chocolate smothering my nose and sprinkles bouncing out of my hair in addition to four people gawking at me.

"Twirl and Dip, the truck's parked outside.  You should check it out, this stuff is amazing...."
author: Rosie C.

description: Heck yah...on those sunny warm days, this is a great find in Golden Gate park.  Yum!
author: Dilly M.

description:
Twirl and Dip is a grown up version of the ice cream trucks I left back home.  

I've been looking for Soft serve ice cream since I moved to the Bay Area in Feb 2011. Plenty of fro-yo, but no ice cream. 
I would ask people, "where does one get some good soft serve ice cream around here?" and people would say, "there's a fro-yo place around the corner, down the street, cross town,etc.." 

People. Soft serve ice cream and frozen yogurt ARE NOT THE SAME.

I'm so happy that my friend remembered this truck existed. Vanilla bean ice cream, with handmade sugar cones.. Yum!

The sundae items on their menu sound so yummy that I would see myself returning. That being said, I wish they had more trucks.. I wish they weren't so far away..  Twirl and Dip, how about a road trip to the East Bay sometime??
author: Frances A.

description:
My friends and I were in the city over the weekend for a day and were walking through Golden Gate Park; we were on our way out to catch the lightrail when we spied the truck. It was warm, so this was perfect! I just started working in SF about a month ago, so I'm still learning about the SF trucks (I know all the trucks in SoCal). 

As usual, I pulled out my iPhone to check Yelp. I went with what many people had talked about -- vanilla chocolate twirl dipped in Tcho dark chocolate and sea salt sprinkles. I've never had organic ice cream before. At first I thought this was a tad on the pricey side, but after eating this, I want more! The Tcho chocolate is delicious and it's not a thin layer like I've had on previous dipped ice creams. It's a delicious thick layer of chocolate; I couldn't get the plastic spoon through it, so I just bit the top of my ice cream. Mmmmm I love sea salt with chocolate; it gives a nice kick from the sweetness. You can get it without the sea salt (they ask you).

I appreciate their passion for organic/fair trade/locally-sourced desserts. Thanks Twirl and Dip!

*They have a permanent location at Golden Gate Park Wednesday-Sunday from 12:30-6pm
author: Katherine S.

description:
obsessed with this place.  the perfect punctuation to a warm sunny day frolicking in lush Golden Gate Park is their chocolate dipped cone with sea salt.    

ice lollies are on point.  strawberry basil was luscious and not too sweet.

the lady who served us was very sweet, though.

10/10 would wander by again.
author: chelsea c.

description: Impressively large menu. Sundaes, sodas, soft serve, floats. Couldn't get them all so I went for a lemon cucumber fruitsicle. Pretty tasty, nice and tart, hints of cucumber juice. If I weren't so full I would try the ginger beer vanilla float the next time around.
author: Kim N.

description: I got the brown sugar banana ice cream. Wasn't really to wow-ed by it. BUT their organic sugar cone is the best! It's crunchy with just the perfect amount of softness to it.
author: Lina C.

description: omg love love love the vanilla bean soft serve in a handmade waffle cone.  The cones are so good but sometimes they run out.  The downside to a germ-fearer like me is that they'll frequently make your order with their dirty money hands.  But I put up with it because the ice cream is so good.
author: Amy M.

description: Got the coconut ice cream with chocolate on top.  It couldn't be put on a cone unless I wanted my hand covered in ice cream and chocolate.  Anyways, the taste was good and I enjoyed my ice cream on this sunny weekend in Golden Gate park.    The only down side I would say is that it's kind of pricey...for my ice cream with chocolate, and a chocolate dipped soft serve it came out to $10.  Can't complain though because you're paying for convenience and pretty good quality.
author: Brian Y.

description: $4 for a vanilla bean soft serve on a cone. Perfect for a day at the park! they also had floats and some other cool choices.
author: Lyssa R.

description:
Although I must admit I enjoyed chasing this truck around town with a few of my girlfriends on Saturday, the end result was less than fulfilling. The soft serve was wayyyy too vanilla-y, and the chocolate coating tasted a little funky.

Over all, it was a very mediocre experience- definitely not worth my break from my (almost) diary-free life.
author: Inna T.

description: Oh my god, the vanilla organic soft served dipped in dark chocolate with sea salt!? What? Amazing! My kids loved the vanilla and chocolate soft serve too! Love this place!
author: Jo M.

description: Coffee ice cream has always been my favorite , so naturally I got the coffee I've cream in a regular cone & WOW ! That was the best coffee ice cream I've ever had !!!! Very friendly and reasonably priced ! I'll definitely be back
author: Lo D.

description: Finally, I was able to catch the Twirl and Dip truck in Golden Gate Park! Awesome vanilla/chocolate swirl on a cone, with TCHO chocolate dip and sea salt.  The chocolate dip was amazing! Instead of that that thin magic shell stuff, this was some seriously thick chocolate bar action.  No leaks or spills, even on an usually warm February day like today. Not bad for under $5! Two thumbs up.
author: Lisa R.

description:
I spotted Twirl and Dip truck near the museum in Golden Gate Park.

They have a wide variety of flavors to choose from.
They are organic, local and handmade.
Some are dairy free.

I always have gotten the salted caramel flavors.

Price is higher(not by too much tho), but so is the quality and taste. So it works out in my book. 

The staff was very friendly and answered questions about dairy in their products. Not to mention they did not take long to get the ice cream done.
author: Roger A.

description: This is your good old Dairy Queen dipped cone on STEROIDS and sprinkled with salt. (Get the salt!)
author: Emily D.

description:
Twirl and Dip's quality soft serve paired with their neighborhood grocery store root beer completed a must-have root beer float on a sunny day at the Marina.  The desirable balance of iciness and creaminess in the soft serve, along with the extra-fizzy root beer, provided an experience unattainable from store-bought gallon ice cream and two-liter bottled root beer.

I will be back to try their uniquely flavored pops!
author: Andrew M.

description: Just had a vanilla twirl with choco chip and English toffee. Also a Vanilla with brownie pieces and roasted almonds. The ice cream is a bit expensive but the toppings are delicious. The English toffee was really good and highly recommended.
author: Rajat S.

description: So so good! Twirl and dip is one of my three favorite ice cream places in the city (right up there with Smitten and Bi-Rite).. I especially like the sundaes with fresh whipped cream and the best cherry ever! My daughter often orders an 'ice lolly' which is a fun homemade Popsicle with fresh fruit pieces in it.
author: Wendy H.

description: The vanilla soft-serve cone was smooth, creamy, and luscious, with flecks of vanilla bean.  Twirl and Dip has renewed my appreciation for soft-serve.  There were non-dairy options for those lactose-intolerant folks, in the form of huge round popsicles resembling ginormous lollypops.  The flavors today were lime cucumber and watermelon white pepper.  The combinations were definitely unique.  I would never have occurred to me to put them together.  Coolness...
author: Melinda Y.

description:
Happened upon this truck while hanging out at the Marina Green. It was even a bit of a chilly day, but I guess that has never deterred me from ice cream.

The soft-served ice cream had real vanilla beans. The grapefruit pop was very grapefruity but a bit too tart for my liking. The treats were good but a bit expensive for what they were.
author: Cindy B.

description: Fan-freakin'-tastic!!!! Best soft serve dip top ever!!!! Go there, worth the trip out to Golden Gate Park. I only wish I had made it out there before the last day of my trip.
author: Corinne B.

description:
Can't believe there's hardly any soft serve in SF, but this truck totally makes up for it. Plus the woman who drives it around is so sweet! She event tweeted her location to my friend and I when we were having trouble finding it.

The truck is a little more expensive than your average ice cream, but it's significantly better. I had a sundae with english toffee, white and dark chocolate sauce, whipped cream and a brandy-soaked cheery with chocolate and vanilla twist ice cream. All sustainable, organic, and yummy, in recyclable/compostable cups and spoons! Only $6 and soo delicious.

My friend had a chocolate dipped twist cone with sea salt. It was really good and only $4. Both of us were so pleased.

It's in Golden Gate park most days from 12-6ish. Check their twitter handle @twirlanddip for details. I do have one reservation, though. The truck needs Square so I can pay with my card! Right now it's cash only, which would have been a total bummer if I hadn't checked out yelp and their site beforehand.
author: christine c.

description:
Ice cream trucks stir up blissful memories of hot summery Midwestern days.  That magical music made every kid run to the street side and plead with their parents for an ice cream sandwich will remain ingrained in my head forever.

When I spotted a cutesy food truck parked in the neighborhood on Friday, I knew that I had no option but stop by to investigate.  My foodie GPS always gets the best of me.  It was about 54 degrees, a little sprinkling out, and definitely windy, but when I realized that "Twirl and Dip" was ice cream, I had an out of body experience.  Never mind that it was cold, wet, windy, and I had just come from the gym.  I was gonna get me some ice cream for dinner.  I'm 25 and no one is looking over my shoulder telling me not to!

I asked for recommendations after being thoroughly overwhelmed by all of the options.  I forked over a $5.00 bill in exchange for a homemade cone (with swirls on it - cute!) and a chocolate/vanilla twist.  It was gone within 10 very happy minutes.  If I knew that there would be an ice cream truck waiting four blocks from home every time I went to the gym, you'd probably find me at a gym a lot more often!
author: Lindsay M.

description:
With soft serve yogurt everywhere, where does one get a simple honest to goodness ice cream soft serve?  I had a craving and not for the tangy yogurt, I wanted a chocolate vanilla swirl on the crunchy styrofoam like textured cone.

Behold Twirl and Dip....organic soft serve ice cream where the vanilla has vanilla beans in it and a chocolate dip made with Tcho chocolate and sprinkled with maldon sea salt.  I savoured each bite and lick and did not speak for 15 minutes.  I mmm'd my way to the end.  It was exactly what I wanted.  However, I wished there was a bit of chocolate in the bottom of the cone to finish it off.  That would probably just blow my mind with that one simple add.  I think I will ask her next time.
author: Miss H.

description:
i couldn't figure out what to eat for dinner tonight...all i knew was that i wanted something good, quick, and cheap...and what do you know...i happened to see the saturday off the grid at mccoppin!  woo woo!  

i had my eye on this truck from the moment we arrived and knew ice cream would be on our list...after trying a few items from other taco trucks, we headed over to twirl and dip.  the dip part is a little deceiving cause i thought they would be dipping soft serve cones in chocolate or something...but they sure got the twirl part down!

i have to start off by saying that their handmade cones are one of THE BEST CONES I HAVE EVER HAD!!!  totally amazing...buttery...perfect texture...omg i'm drooling just thinking about it.  

the soft serve was well, soft...a little too soft for my taste...but the flavor was there...i ordered the vanilla bean and you could see the little specks of bean in the ice cream.  

wifey ordered the shake which came with brittle and whipped cream...she said it was YUMMY!  

really quality stuff...about 10 bucks for both of our items...my favorite stop today!
author: Jen W.

description:
If you were ever a teenage girl dabbled in dieting, you probably have tried one of those sugar-free, fat-free soft serve ice cream things.  That saccharin taste which is forever etched in my brain puts up a warning sign anytime I see "soft serve" in my adulthood.  Nowadays I want nothing but the real thing.  The creamier the better.

I am so glad I tried the soft serve chocolate and vanilla ice cream at Twirl and Dip though.  I didn't know soft serve can be creamy and delicious!  

$5 for ice cream is pretty steep, but the portion is generous enough to be shared and the location couldn't be more perfect.  It really adds a ton of pleasure to a sunny day stroll in the beautiful GG park.
author: Candice B.

description:
Unlike the other reviewers, I wasn't as impressed with the ice cream/soft serve. Yea yea... its organic, local, seasonal ect, but  I am not willing to sacrifice taste/quality, and if you have to do that for the organic factor, its not worth it!

 I am giving it three stars because of the high price and few choices. When I go for soft-serve its about the experience, consistency, look, as well as taste! This soft-serve didn't quite wow me on any of those counts.  IThe soft-serve only had vanilla and chocoalte nutmeg to choose from.  I thought that the vanilla needed a little bit more vanilla bean to be a specialty treat and the chocolate nutmeg was a little heavy on the nutmeg which made it just a little too bitter (cool idea though) It was also too melty- not good consistency. 

I had the ice cream sandwich- cookies ($4.5) with home baked cookies and vanilla in the middle.  The cookies were good, but nothing that I couldn't make at home. 

I wish I had gotten the honey-melon popsicle (sugar free!) or the strawberry creamsicle.. those looked really delicious, and definitely worth the 3 dollar cost.- couldn't make those at home or get it better somewhere else!

They also had sundae topping available, which seemed a little pricey on top of the 3 dollar/scoop cost. It would have been nice if they had pre-designed sundaes with a set price. 

They said that yesterday was their first day they have been selling in the ctiy, so hopefully they will come out with more flavors so I can give them a second change!
author: Sirina K.

description:
There is chocolate ice cream. There is mint ice cream. And then there is Twirl & Dip's chocolate mint soft serve. A blend well done. Portion size is pretty small, which is par for the course as you are also paying for the artisan and food truck nature of the experience. 

Appreciated the takeout effort as much as the goods: wrapped with saran wrap with a spoon tucked inside, I made it all the way back to the office with minimal mess.
author: Jason B.

description: After the Deyoung my girlfriend wanted to go here-  I had no idea what a treat I was in for. I was really surprised to find most everything was hand made and totally amazing!!! I had a handmade sugar cone w/soft serve vanilla, chocolate dipped with sea salt and homemade toffee on top. It was really amazing. There was so much love, stellar quality,hard work, and thought put into all the ingredients. What an experience. I had no idea I would find something I like more then Bi-rite and Mitchels in SF let alone on a truck in GG park however that is what happened. Fantastic!!! Favorite ice cream experience I have had in SF period.
author: Mark W.

description:
My buddy and I went to the Academy of Sciences on the monthly free Wednesday.  Didn't know the hype about the truck before nor have I seen the show Crave yet, just seemed like another ice cream truck.  It was a nice day out so we figured we could use some ice cream.  Got just a vanilla/chocolate swirl on sugar cone.  BEST ICE CREAM CONE I HAVE EVER HAD.  Just the cone itself worth the 5 bucks.   And the ice cream was great too.  

I am going to bring the gf next time and try more things on the menu.

Cold Stone is just not going to do it for me anymore....
author: Anthonio C.

description: Was lucky enough to try twirl and dip at a private party I was working. My coworkers seemed to love the soft serve while I had a watermelon white pepper ice lolly. I was beyond impressed. The combination was superb! The ladies on the truck were super friendly as well.
author: Erica A.

description: Worth the wait!! Delicious creamy soft swirl dipped in chocolate & sprinkled with a little sea salt. Yummy. After enjoying the De Young we were in the mood for a sweet treat, thanks to Yelp we found the perfect place. We waited about 10 minutes. Cash only! Enjoyed ours in the sunny park between the De Young and Cal Academy of Sciences. We will definitely be back!
author: K M.

description:
BF and I walked out of the De Young jonesing for some delicious ice cream. We were all set to just huff it back to our nearby corner store at 3rd and Hugo when I remembered seeing a brightly colored ice-cream truck at MLK Dr. in the park. We ambled over that way and saw a line of about 10 people waiting.

The menu here is extensive- angsty decision makers be forewarned- but that is because everything and I mean EVERYTHING sounds so amazingly delicious. 

Had a craving for chocolate so I got the vanilla and chocolate swirl soft serve chocolate dipped with sea salt on a sugar cone. Damn, I mean damn that was good. BF got a ginger-beer vanilla ice cream float that was also out of this world.

We will definitely be back, because I NEED to try a burnt sugar banana sundae and/or a canteloupe gewurtztraminer popsicle!

Get there people, it's totally delicious!
author: Jessica P.

description: Absolutely fabulous the handmade sugar cones are amazing. Vanilla bean soft serve was out of this world delicious! The dark chocolate dip with sea salt was excellent. All around high quality and very tasty. Expensive but worth it!
author: Nicole B.

description: I live for soft serve so I was super excited when I discovered this truck.  I had the chocolate and vanilla swirl and paid the extra buck 25 for the sugar cone. The cone was amazing.... But spending 5 bucks I expected more ice cream in the cone! My friend got a regular cone which was pretty puny... I would have given 4 stars if not for that.  The ice cream itself is great quality and delicious!
author: Julie B.

description: Thank you, Twirl and Dip, for providing my company with an awesome dessert intermission to our Quarterly Staff Meeting. I had my choice of soft serve vanilla, chocolate, or a mix, as well as sorbet bars w/honey and coconut, a grapefruit riesling, and a Meyer Lemon with bitters. I ordered the chocolate vanilla mix with rainbow and chocolate sprinkles--so delicious! If I hadn't been pregnant, I might have gone for one of the options w/bitters or riesling. Next time...
author: Beth F.

description: So damn good! I've had their frozen fruit pops dipped in chocolate sprinkled with sea salt, and I've had their chocolate dipped frozen bananas. Both were insanely delicious vegan options. I recommend it to everyone because there is something for everyone. They also have organic ice creams and the chocolate dip is made from TCHO chocolate, which is a San Francisco based fair trade company.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: I took my sister to the deYoung for Girl with a Pearl Earring this weekend, and she said we had to stop by and get ice cream from Twirl and Dip. Since I am lactose intolerant, I went along but wasn't planning on partaking in the dairy pleasures. As we walked there, she extolled the amazingness of the ice cream of Twirl and Dip and how it wasn't like any other ice cream. I couldn't resist and ordered a swirl topped with toasted almonds (chocolate and vanilla swirl) soft serve. Yum!! I guess it must be super fresh or they put some secret ingredients to make their ice cream so yummy. Who cares that I'm lactose intolerant?
author: Eva G.

description: Oh how I love walking into Golden Gate Park and seeing that cheerful truck just waiting to make people happy. TCHO chocolate dipped soft serve with sea salt = that's enough for me to ignore my dairy allergy and dive in.
author: Sara W.

description:
Man I love soft serve ice cream! It was just a coincidence that I ran into the Twirl and Dip while enjoying a beautiful Saturday afternoon at the Marina Greens. 

I went with the classic vanilla and chocolate swirl in a home made cone. The soft serve ice cream was as good as it gets (you know that all natural, organic good stuff). But the home made cone was AMAZING!! It was mind blowing-ly good. I never tasted a cone that good before. I could probably eat like 5 of them just plain sans the ice cream.

Thanks to the Twirl and Dip, the plain ol' sugar cone and waffle cone has forever been ruined for me! Neither will taste as good to me anymore in comparison to the home made cone offering courtesy of the Twirl and Dip.
author: Allan Y.

description: I had the lemon fresh fruit lollie and I loved it! Tasted really fresh, and perfect for the weather. My friends and I went back to try the chocolate dipped banana with sea salt, which was also delicious. The man is also super friendly and sweet. I highly recommend it!
author: Manizeh R.

description: The most delicious dipped cone I have ever had!!! I had the vanilla dipped cone with toasted coconut. The soft serve ice cream is so good, like homemade, and the chocolate is a cross between milk and dark chocolate. It's just real chocolate, no paraffin, all natural and awesome!
author: Sherrie L.

description:
3.5 stars

I got the luxury of trying Twirl and Dip's homemade hard ice cream in front of the UN Plaza due to Off the Grid.

Tasting notes
Mint Chip: Lingering peppermint creamy smoothness and the mini chocolate chips that tasted like melting saltine crackers
Coffee: Super aromatic coffee beans like eating a creamy iced coffee

Prices
1 scoop - $2.50
2 scoops - $3.50 (KH and I got this in two separate bio degradable cups with two mini compostable spoons, I'm saving the spoon for my next adventure to the truck) 

Service
I was actually saddened that it took a little bit for the ice cream to be scooped but the wait was worth it

Can't wait to taste their other flavors!
author: Jen L.

description: The vanilla soft serve here was great! I also enjoyed the sprinkles -- they had quite a lot of flavor/texture. It is a little on the pricey side, especially when toppings are taken into account. Very friendly staff.
author: Joe S.

description: After a recent visit to the de Young Museum in Golden Gate Park my kids and I were walking across the street from this brightly painted ice cream truck and were drawn over by the lovely smell of fresh warm baked waffle cones!   I ordered the chocolate dipped chocolate soft serve ice cream on a waffle cone...and it was absolutely delightful!  I would recommend giving it a try and being a little more adventurous, because there were a lot more flavors to choose from :)
author: Liza M.

description: So ... I want to say I would love a truck like this in my hometown of LA... but I'de rather not pay that much for soft serve and just buy juice or something instead. The chocolate dip was delicious... don't get me wrong... but it wasn't memorable.
author: Sarina H.

description: Not "dirt cheap" but c'mon people, it's on the go and not some stationary restaurant. My partner and I were fortunate enough to discover Twirl and Dip one day while we were waiting for some family to meet us in Golden Gate Park. It was truly nostalgic and delicious! I would most certainly stop for Twirl and Dip again, so give them a try!
author: Carlos H.

description:
I was turned off at first at how expensive the ice cream at Twirl and Dip was. $3.50 for a tiny cup? You've got to be kidding me. On the other hand, there are some days where you just need some ice cream, and these hot San Francisco days are no exception.  

I got the chocolate and vanilla swirl and man oh man, I have not had ice cream that deliciously satisfying in a while.  The vanilla is superb.  I was sad that it kind of got dwarfed by the chocolate, which was good but not nearly as delicious as the vanilla. I also tried a little bit of my friend's strawberry fruitsicle and it was so good. It was delicious and so refreshing for such a hot day. 

So, yeah. The prices might be on the steeper side for a cup of ice cream, but you are paying for some quality and delicious stuff.  Don't miss out on it the next time you see the truck in your area.
author: Alea G.

description: People: get a grip on yourselves! I love the food truck movement as much as the next girl, but come on, FIVE BUCKS for a small soft serve cone?? Have you all lost your minds? I don't care if it's made out of strawberries hand grown in the Queen of England's backyard by her highness herself. You're talking about five bucks for a small soft serve. Sheesh!
author: Amy B.

description: Omg got the brown sugar banana with choc chips & dark choc sauce...it was the most amazing ice cream I have ever had. I'm not even an ice cream person & I know I will crave this!
author: Rita I.

description:
it's good esp on a hot day, but nothing to write home about (and kind of expensive)

the bf and i were walking around golden gate park on the way to the deyoung and were excited to see this fun truck surrounded by adults and kids with softserve.  we ordered it and it was good...just kind of pricey (but i guess it's because it's organic).
author: Elaine G.

description: A bit pricier than what I am used to for soft serve BUT service was friendly and the vanilla soft serve chocolate dipped w salt on top that I shared with my boyfriend was absolutely delish!!!!
author: Lynn C.

description: I agree with other posts. The ice cream was good, nothing to write home about, but expensive. And they need to get SQUARE! We would have bought TWO ice cream cones if we could have used our card.
author: Melissa N.

description: Honestly the best soft-serve ice cream of my life! Vanilla dipped in tcho chocolate sprinkled with sea salt in a homemade waffle come...it honestly doesn't get any better than that. I am still dreaming of that cone and it's been a few weeks! It is pricey, but worth it for the occasional splurge (in money and calories!)
author: K. D.

description: Great ice-cream, on the go. Definitely get the soft serve on the house made sugar coated waffle cone.
author: Gopi V.

description: If you treat yourself to Twirl and Dip, I'd recommend getting the chocolate/vanilla 'twirl' that is 'dipped' into the chocolate. This soft serve is delicious, and so rich that I barely finished it. Too bad for Twirl and Dip that my sweet tooth was satiated for an entire week, so I won't be back for a little while.
author: katrina w.

description: YUM!!! My boyfriend and I with our dog drove by this place and decided to stop by there after we had lunc hin the park. There was a little line and they have a good variety. The ice cream is organic, so there is no artificial after taste. I got the chocolate and vanilla twirl with a homemade sugar cone which is much more delicate than the original.  It was one of the best soft serves I have ever had and for some reason I don't feel guity about eating this ice cream. I just say to myself it's organic so it's ok. The truck is by the Academy of Sciences so stop by if you want a snack!!
author: Lana K.

description: So friggin' yummy. The hand rolled waffle cone & sea salt sprinkle on the TCHO chocolate dipped soft serve vanilla ice cream was heavenly!
author: Lawrence G.

description: The best chocolate-dipped vanilla soft-serve I have ever had. Perfect texture, rich chocolate flavor, and a bit of sea-salt on top to accentuate the sweetness. My son loved the swirl with rainbow sprinkles. (He'll eat anything with rainbow sprinkles, though, so does that count?)
author: Eli R.

description: Pretty overpriced (3 or 3.50 for just ice cream, and at least a dollar more if you want to try any of the interesting toppings!) The mint chip (a scoop variety) was good, but not exceptional, but the fair trade dark chocolate dip with sea salt was AMAZING. The chocolate was really good quality, and the salt really added to the flavor! I also tried the vanilla soft serve (which was probably better than most soft serves), and the handmade chocolate and butterscotch sauces, which were excellent (and also slightly salty).
author: Annie O.

description: Creamy organic ice cream dipped in REAL chocolate with a touch of sea salt? What's not to love? Can't wait to try something else next time!
author: Piper m.

description: Alas, if you're looking for classic East Coast soft-serve, this ice cream will do absolutely nothing to satisfy that craving.  The chocolate is waaaaay too chocolatey and doesn't have that nice whipped Carvelesque consistency.  The vanilla has flecks of vanilla bean (!), which is so West Coast.  Carvel, please come to SF.  I miss you.
author: A W.

description: Perfect on a SF sunny day after a long bike ride across the GG bridge! I rode by and thought "hmm, this looks like it would really hit the spot" and it did! I had the tangerine popsicle and the BF had the vanilla bean soft serve with the waffle cone. Both were absolutely delicious. Popsicle tastes like a fruit icee with really strong flavor (not your mom's homemade popsicles!). The BF's vanilla bean soft serve was amazing! The vanilla bean flavor really shone through and the waffle cone was definitely worth the extra $1. Don't pass this up the next time you see the truck hanging around Crissy field!
author: Angela L.

description: Took an out of town friend with me on a walk through the park just to find this truck. I know they are usually at GGP along MLK drive so we walked a bit first and rewarded ourselves with chocolate/vanilla swirl soft serve covered in dark chocolate and sprinkled with sea salt. We loved every bite!
author: Amanda B.

description:
I really wanted to like this place! It was eeh. I ordered the vanilla-chocolate twirl with chocolate dip. It looked good, but I've definitely had better. The chocolate dip was a weird chewy texture and the soft serve started melting and dripping all over my hands and cone after my first bite. My first bite! The vanilla part of the twirl tasted stronger than the chocolate, which was a pleasant surprise. 

I won't be coming back here by choice, but if I do happen to pass by while in Golden Gate Park, I will give Twirl and Dip a second chance.

One star for everything being homemade and organic, the second one for the vanilla bean.
author: Sabina Y.

description:
Honey Melon Fruitiscle? Yes please! What a perfect little dessert on a hot San Francisco afternoon! I like to think of myself as a fruit connoisseur- I like 99.95% of all fruits. So when I saw an assortment of fruitsicles available, my taste buds perked up. My choices were honey melon, strawberry and strawberry creamsicle. I always like to ask the food makers/wait staff which they prefer (cause really, who better to ask???) so I took the suggestion of the nice lady at the window and went with the honey melon ($3) because melons are apparently still in season. 
My tongue peeked out cautiously and met the surface of the fruitsicle. It was met with a sweet, subtle taste of honeydew melon. Ohhhh so refreshing! I went on enjoying it until I tasted my bf's chocolate nutmeg ice cream on a homemade cone with almonds ($4.25) that my taste buds got confused and couldn't taste the melon... I gave them a little pep talk and was able to enjoy the rest of it. :)
author: Amanda W.

description: Awesome! Stopped by & got cones with my boyfriend, they were amazing! Highly recommend
author: Erin S.

description:
I wish I could give Twirl and Dip more than 5 stars, they are THAT good!  

We hired Meg and Siri and their Twirl and Dip soft serve truck for our son's preschool birthday party.  We wanted something that our son would go bonkers over and that he would remember forever (especially since we're bidding adieu to the city and all his preschool buds as we prepare for a big move to the burbs) .  We've done the bouncy house, had gourmet cupcakes, all the typical city birthday party stuff .. but this, THIS topped them all!  Not only was Meg friendly and warm and easy to deal with, but she and Siri pulled up in their truck a little early, stayed a little late and genuinely seemed to enjoy serving ice cream to about 30 3-5 year olds who were each very particular about just what they wanted in/on their treat.  At the end, they even invited my 2 boys into the truck to see the inner workings of a real, live ice cream truck.  They were still talking about it at bedtime tonight and one of them is even sporting the Twirl and Dip sticker on his jammies.  

Oh and most importantly, I should mention the soft serve ice cream is delicious!  The little ones loved the vanilla, chocolate and swirl and I will speak for all of the parents in saying the butterscotch sundae was out of this world.  I will be stalking the Marina Green each and every day till we move, just to get a little more of Twirl and Dips yummy sundaes.  

Stop by the Twirl and Dip truck at the Marina Green or in Golden Gate park or heck, hire them for your next birthday or office party, or even a wedding!  You and your guests will be happy you did. We're still smiling about how successful our son's birthday was, thanks to Meg and Siri!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Love this place! The best ice cream I ever had. Don't forget to have your ice cream dipped in chocolate and sprinkled with sea salt, a must try!
author: Lela N.

description: I hired Twirl and Dip to serve ice cream at my wedding, they were the greatest.  The best part was that they played Turkey in the Straw when they pulled up.
author: Philip G.
